analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyang yangs pa can gyi nye 'khor na mdza' bo dag dang dbyar tshul du zhugs so //
translated: The nuns also entered the rains retreat in the vicinity of Vaiśālī with their friends.

original: ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to serve the Teacher,

original: kun dga' bo ni 'od @42b ma can de nyid du dbyar tshul du zhugs so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ni 'od @42b ma can de nyid du dbyar tshul du zhugs so //
translated: Ānanda entered the rains retreat right there in Āmrapālī’s grove.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma de dag gis 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma de dag gis 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: At that time, the nuns thought this:

original: da ltar gyi dus na mu ge byung bas sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na mu ge byung bas sdug bsngal te /
translated: “Now, at this time of famine, we are suffering.

original: bsod snyoms slong bas kyang rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms slong bas kyang rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: It is difficult to obtain alms,

original: khyim pa dag gis rang gi bu'i zas sbyar ba yang dka' na /
analyzed: khyim pa dag gis rang gi bu'i zas sbyar ba yang dka' na /
translated: and it is difficult for householders to provide food even for their own children,

original: dge slong ma rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: let alone for the nuns.

original: bdag cag rnams ni grags pa chung la /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams ni grags pa chung la /
translated: We have little renown,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni yon tan la dga' bas ci nas bdag cag phan tshun yon tan brjod par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni yon tan la dga' bas ci nas bdag cag phan tshun yon tan brjod par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: and worldly people delight in qualities. Therefore, we should praise each other’s qualities.”

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag gi gnas du song nas smras pa grong phyogs gang na 'di 'dra ba'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnams 'khod pa de dag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag khyed kyis rnyed pa rab tu rnyed de /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag gi gnas du song nas smras pa grong phyogs gang na 'di 'dra ba'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun rnams 'khod pa de dag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag khyed kyis rnyed pa rab tu rnyed de /
translated: In whatever direction this community of nuns is staying, that direction is blessed.

original: dge slong ma 'dis ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du thob bo //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'dis ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du thob bo //
translated: This nun has attained the four meditations, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dge slong ma 'dis tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi thob pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'dis tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi thob pa'o //
translated: This nun has attained the four immeasurables, the six superknowledges, and the four fruits of spiritual practice.🔽This nun has attained the state of an arhat.”

original: dge slong ma 'dis ni dgra pa bcom pa thob bo zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa ni yon tan dag la dga' bas bdag gi bu la sbyin pa dang / sbyar bar mi sems so //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'dis ni dgra pa bcom pa thob bo zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten pa ni yon tan dag la dga' bas bdag gi bu la sbyin pa dang / sbyar bar mi sems so //
translated: Because worldly people delight in good qualities, they did not think of giving their daughters to their son.

original: de dag dbyar zla gsum 'das nas chos gos zin nas mnyan du yod par phyin to //
analyzed: de dag dbyar zla gsum 'das nas chos gos zin nas mnyan du yod par phyin to //
translated: After the three months of summer had passed, they finished making their robes and went to Śrāvastī.

original: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis 'phags ma khyed kyis dbyar gang du tshul du zhugs zhes dris pa dang / 'phags ma dag bdag cag ni yul bri dza'i grong na'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis 'phags ma khyed kyis dbyar gang du tshul du zhugs zhes dris pa dang / 'phags ma dag bdag cag ni yul bri dza'i grong na'o //
translated: “Noble ladies, we spent it in the city of Vṛji.”🔽“Well, did you enjoy it? Were you not troubled by alms-round?”

original: 'o na bde ba la reg par spyod dam bsod snyoms kyis ma brel tam zhes smras pa dang / de dag gis bdag cag ni bde ba la reg par spyod cing bsod snyoms kyis kyang ma bral to //
analyzed: 'o na bde ba la reg par spyod dam bsod snyoms kyis ma brel tam zhes smras pa dang / de dag gis bdag cag ni bde ba la reg par spyod cing bsod snyoms kyis kyang ma bral to //
translated: “We enjoyed it and were not troubled by alms-round.”🔽“Well, what was the cause and what was the condition that brought this about?”

original: 'o na rgyu gang rkyen gang gis 'brel par ma gyur 'jig rten pa ni yon tan la dga' ste /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gang rkyen gang gis 'brel par ma gyur 'jig rten pa ni yon tan la dga' ste /
translated: “The world delights in good qualities.

original: bdag cag gcig gis gcig gi yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gcig gis gcig gi yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We spoke of each other’s good qualities.”

original: ci bden nam 'on te brdzun du smras /
analyzed: ci bden nam 'on te brdzun du smras /
translated: “Was that true or was it false?”🔽“It was false.”

original: brdzun du'o // de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: brdzun du'o // de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Teacher.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said,🔽“Monks, did you say something that is beyond human capacity?”

original: dge slong ma mang po la khyed kyis mi chos las bla mar gyur pa smras pa bden nam /
analyzed: dge slong ma mang po la khyed kyis mi chos las bla mar gyur pa smras pa bden nam /
translated: “Yes, we did.”

original: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol ba dang / rnam grangs du mas smad do //🔽nyan thos ma rnams la 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol ba dang / rnam grangs du mas smad do // nyan thos ma rnams la 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: “Venerable, you are right.”🔽The Buddha reprimanded her in many ways and established a training rule for the nuns.

original: yang dge @43a * //
analyzed: yang dge @43a * //
translated: Furthermore, the virtuous🔽

original: slong ma gang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes la /🔽med pa med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa dang / mtha' dang 'phags pa'i bye brag thob pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba dang / reg par spyod pa med pa la med bzhin du 'di shes so 'di mthong ngo zhes khas 'chi ba las nyes pa byung ba tshangs par 'dod nas /🔽de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung 'phags ma rnams bdag gis mi shes par shes so zhes smras /
analyzed: slong ma gang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes la / med pa med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa dang / mtha' dang 'phags pa'i bye brag thob pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba dang / reg par spyod pa med pa la med bzhin du 'di shes so 'di mthong ngo zhes khas 'chi ba las nyes pa byung ba tshangs par 'dod nas / de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung 'phags ma rnams bdag gis mi shes par shes so zhes smras /
translated: If a nun does not know and understand,🔽but claims to know and understand, and then, when questioned and examined, she says, ‘I did not know it, Venerables, I was mistaken,’ she commits an offense entailing confession when she makes the claim.🔽If a nun does not know and understand,

original: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: but claims to know and understand, and then, when questioned and examined, she says, ‘I did not see it, Venerables, I was mistaken,’🔽she commits an offense entailing confession when she makes the claim.

original: gso ba gsog brdzun du smras so zhes de de skad kyang zer na dge slong ma de yang phas pham pa yin gyis lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang / dge slong ma mang zhig rnal 'byor la brtson pas zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma zhig la brten nas /
analyzed: gso ba gsog brdzun du smras so zhes de de skad kyang zer na dge slong ma de yang phas pham pa yin gyis lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o zhes de ltar bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang / dge slong ma mang zhig rnal 'byor la brtson pas zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma zhig la brten nas /
translated: The nun said, I was joking, but the other nuns said, If you said that, then you have committed a defeating offense and should not live among us.🔽 Thus, they established a rule.

original: 'jig rten kyi lam yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa sel te /
analyzed: 'jig rten kyi lam yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa sel te /
translated: Many nuns, through striving in yoga, eliminated afflictions by bringing to mind the signs of meditative serenity based on the mundane path.

original: dge bcom pa yang thog sogs pa mi spyod pas /
analyzed: dge bcom pa yang thog sogs pa mi spyod pas /
translated: They did not commit the offense of destroying virtue.

original: de dag phan tshun 'phags ma bdag gis thob par bya /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'phags ma bdag gis thob par bya /
translated: They said to each other, We have attained the state of an arya.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spyod pa thob par bya ba ni bdag gis thob zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spyod pa thob par bya ba ni bdag gis thob zin to //
translated: We have attained the state of not engaging in the afflictions such as attachment.

original: skye ba ni zad tshangs par spyad pa ni spyod bya ba ni byas srid pa gzhan mi shes te /
analyzed: skye ba ni zad tshangs par spyad pa ni spyod bya ba ni byas srid pa gzhan mi shes te /
translated: We have exhausted birth, purified defilements, done what is to be done, and will know no other life than this.

original: dgra bcom pa yang thog po zhes bya ba las de dag khyim pa mo dang / dge tshul ma dang / lhan cig gnas pa las nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang / de dag gcig la gcig smras pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang thog po zhes bya ba las de dag khyim pa mo dang / dge tshul ma dang / lhan cig gnas pa las nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang / de dag gcig la gcig smras pa /
translated: When they gave rise to afflictions, they said to each other,

original: bdag cag khyim pa mo dang / dge tshul ma dang lhan cig tu 'dres shing gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag cag khyim pa mo dang / dge tshul ma dang lhan cig tu 'dres shing gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: “When we live together with householders, novices, and nuns,

original: nyon mongs pa de dag slar skyes na ston pas ni med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa smras na pham mo zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag slar skyes na ston pas ni med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa smras na pham mo zhes gsungs na /
translated: if those afflictions arise again, the Teacher has said that we will be defeated if we claim to be superior to human beings without actually being so.🔽We think we have not been defeated.”

original: bdag cag pham par ma gyur grang snyam pa dang / de lta bur gyur pa dge slong mas dge slong pha la smras pa dang / de dag gis ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: bdag cag pham par ma gyur grang snyam pa dang / de lta bur gyur pa dge slong mas dge slong pha la smras pa dang / de dag gis ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: The nuns told the monks what had happened, and they asked the Teacher.

original: bka' stsal pa snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
translated: He said, “The previous rule was a proscription.

original: 'di ni rjes su gnang bas na nyan thos ma rnams la 'dul ba'i gnas bca'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su gnang bas na nyan thos ma rnams la 'dul ba'i gnas bca'o //
translated: This is a permission. Therefore, the nuns should establish a rule of the Vinaya.”

original: yang dge slong ma gang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes pa med la med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa dang / mtha' dang 'phags pa'i bye brag thob pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba @43b dang ; reg par spyod pa med la med bzhin du 'di shes pa'o 'di mthong ngo zhes khas 'che ba las nyes pa byung ba tshangs par 'dod nas /🔽de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang mngon par mi shes shing yongs su mi shes pa med la med bzhin du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa dang / mtha' dang 'phags pa'i bye brag thob pa dang / shes pa dang mthong ba @43b dang ; reg par spyod pa med la med bzhin du 'di shes pa'o 'di mthong ngo zhes khas 'che ba las nyes pa byung ba tshangs par 'dod nas / de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung /
translated: “Also, a nun who, not knowing and not understanding, pretends to know and understand, and then, when questioned by other nuns, is unable to resolve their questions, and finally admits,

original: ma dris kyang rung 'phags ma rnams bdag gis na mi shes par shes so zhes smras so //
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung 'phags ma rnams bdag gis na mi shes par shes so zhes smras so //
translated: ‘Noble women, I did not know that, I was ignorant, I did not understand, and so I said, “I know that, I see that,”’

original: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te gsob sog brdzun du smras so zhes de skad zer na /
analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te gsob sog brdzun du smras so zhes de skad zer na /
translated: and says, ‘I was lying, false, and in error,’

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma gtogs te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma gtogs te /
translated: except in a case of overestimation,

original: dge slong ma de yang phas pham pa yin gyis lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma de yang phas pham pa yin gyis lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: is also defeated and should not be allowed to remain.”

original: mngon par mi shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi lam mi shes pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas ma shes pa dang ; mi rtag pa la mi rtag par mi shes pa la sogs te /
analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi lam mi shes pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas ma shes pa dang ; mi rtag pa la mi rtag par mi shes pa la sogs te /
translated: Non-knowledge is ignorance of the mundane path, ignorance through non-conformity, and ignorance of impermanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa'o //🔽yong su mi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnam par grol ba mi shes pa dang / rjes su mi mthun pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa'o // yong su mi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnam par grol ba mi shes pa dang / rjes su mi mthun pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa ste /
translated: It is ignorance through impermanence.🔽Non-knowledge is ignorance of the supramundane path, ignorance through non-conformity, and ignorance of the non-existence of permanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa med par mi shes pa ni rjes su mi mthun pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa med par mi shes pa ni rjes su mi mthun pa'i sgo nas mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance through non-conformity.

original: mi'i chos zhes bya ba nis grib pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mi'i chos zhes bya ba nis grib pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five human stains are:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dong chags dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / 'gyod pa dang g-yeng ba dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dong chags dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / 'gyod pa dang g-yeng ba dang / the tshom mo //
translated: desire, malice, sleepiness and drowsiness, regret, and doubt.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las bla ma'i gzugs so ;
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las bla ma'i gzugs so ;
translated: The higher realms are the form realm, which is higher than the desire realm.

original: / de'i bla ma ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: / de'i bla ma ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The higher of that is the formless realm.

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa las mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “extreme” refers to nirvana.

original: 'phags ma zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi 'bras bu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'phags ma zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi 'bras bu bzhi'o //
translated: “Noble one” refers to the four fruits of the monk.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni ye shes bcu ste /
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni ye shes bcu ste /
translated: “Knowledge” refers to the ten knowledges.

original: sdug bsngal la chos su ye shes dang / sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i ye shes te /🔽de bzhin du bden pa bzhi la gcig cing gnyis gnyis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos su ye shes dang / sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i ye shes te / de bzhin du bden pa bzhi la gcig cing gnyis gnyis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni brgyad de /
translated: The knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering and the knowledge that is subsequent to the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering.🔽Similarly, with regard to the four truths, there is the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering and the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la chos su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / bden pa bzhi la de bzhin du gnyis gnyis te brgyad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / bden pa bzhi la de bzhin du gnyis gnyis te brgyad do //
translated: In this way, there are eight knowledges with regard to the four truths.

original: reg par spyod pa med la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg par spyod pa med la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One does not experience” means

original: mngon sum du ma thob pa thob bo zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma thob pa thob bo zhes zer ba'o //
translated: that one says, “I have attained what was not attained.”🔽“Without” means

original: med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag la dbang yod do //
analyzed: med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag la dbang yod do //
translated: that one says, “I have power over myself.”

original: thob par bya ba ni sla ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni sla ste /
translated: “It is easy to attain” means

original: thob par bya ba 'am mi bya bar zad do zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba 'am mi bya bar zad do zhes zer ba'o //
translated: that one says, “It is either attained or not attained.”

original: 'di shes zhes 'di mthong zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'o //🔽khas 'che @44a * //
analyzed: 'di shes zhes 'di mthong zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'o // khas 'che @44a * //
translated: The phrase I know this and I see this refers to gods and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi shes par shes so zhes zer ba dang / ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes khas 'che ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi shes par shes so zhes zer ba dang / ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes khas 'che ba'o //
translated: To boast means to say, I know what I do not know and I see what I do not see.

original: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyi zhig na'o //
translated: At another time means at a later time.

original: dris kyang rung 'gyod pa skyes nas rang smra ba'o //
analyzed: dris kyang rung 'gyod pa skyes nas rang smra ba'o //
translated: Even when questioned, one speaks out of remorse.

original: 'phags ma rnams bdag gis mi shes par shes so zhes smras /
analyzed: 'phags ma rnams bdag gis mi shes par shes so zhes smras /
translated: Noble ones, I said, 'I know what I do not know.'

original: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: I said, 'I see what I do not see.'

original: gsob gsog ces bya ba ni yon tan med par kha zas dang grags pa med par smra ba'i phyir snod stong ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gsob gsog ces bya ba ni yon tan med par kha zas dang grags pa med par smra ba'i phyir snod stong ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Empty and hollow means that, like an empty vessel, one speaks without qualities and without fame.

original: brdzun zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pas nas gzhan bslus pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pas nas gzhan bslus pa'o //
translated: False means deceiving others through perception.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dngos po yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dngos po yod pa'o //
translated: Bhikshuni means having the status of a bhikshuni.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: That also means that which is taught.

original: phas pham par gyur te mi'i chos la bla mar gyur pa dang / rang gi tshig dang / bdag gi phyir dang / gzhan gyi don go ba'o //🔽de la ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na /🔽lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / ye dgas la sogs pa ma mthong ba mthong ngo zhes zer na spom por 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du de dag gi sgra thos so zhes zer ba yang de bzhin du bshad par bya'o //🔽lha la sogs pa nas dur khrod kyi sha za yan chad gong du smos pa rnams bdag la ltar 'ong ngo zhe 'am bdag de dag ltar zhes pa dang / gong ma bzhin du sbyar ro //

translated: The defeat is the loss of the status of a monk, and the superior human qualities are the qualities of the path of seeing.🔽What is the transgression?🔽 If one says, I have seen gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, mahoragas, and so on, one commits a serious transgression.🔽Similarly, if one says, I have heard their voices, one commits a serious transgression.🔽If one says, The gods and so on, as mentioned above, have come to see me, or I have gone to them, one commits a serious transgression.🔽

original: dge slong gang la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis spang ba'i las byas par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong gang la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis spang ba'i las byas par gyur te /
translated: The monk who had been given the act of banishment by the community of monks🔽was also given the vow of not bowing down by the community of nuns.

original: de la dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis kyang phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa byin par gyur pa dang / de la dge slong ma dag gis gtam dang phyag ma byed cig mthong nas ldang ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de la dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis kyang phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa byin par gyur pa dang / de la dge slong ma dag gis gtam dang phyag ma byed cig mthong nas ldang ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The nuns did not speak to him or bow down to him, except when they saw him and then they got up.

original: de nas gre las skyes dge 'dun gyis spangs pa dang / dge slong ma'i gan du 'ongs nas gtam dang kun du gtam zer ba dang / lta bar mi byed stan las langs te 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas gre las skyes dge 'dun gyis spangs pa dang / dge slong ma'i gan du 'ongs nas gtam dang kun du gtam zer ba dang / lta bar mi byed stan las langs te 'khod do //
translated: Then, after the monk who was born from a womb had been banished by the community, he came to the nuns and they did not speak to him or bow down to him.

original: gre las skyes kyis smras pa dge slong gang gi dge 'dun la bdag gis nyes pa byas pas na dge 'dun gyis spangs par ni rigs na /
analyzed: gre las skyes kyis smras pa dge slong gang gi dge 'dun la bdag gis nyes pa byas pas na dge 'dun gyis spangs par ni rigs na /
translated: The Buddha said, Because you have committed an offense against the saṅgha of monks, it is right that the saṅgha should expel you.

original: dge slong ma rnams la bdag gis nyes pa ci byas na bdag la mi smra zhing phyag mi byed ces smras pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag mos gzhan la smra ba ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la bdag gis nyes pa ci byas na bdag la mi smra zhing phyag mi byed ces smras pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag mos gzhan la smra ba ltar bya ste /
translated: But what offense have you committed against the nuns that they will not speak to you or bow to you?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bdag cag gi ston pa dge 'dun ni bdag cag gi rten te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bdag cag gi ston pa dge 'dun ni bdag cag gi rten te /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, is our teacher and the saṅgha is our refuge.

original: dge 'dun la nyes pa byed pa de bdag cag la yang nyes pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la nyes pa byed pa de bdag cag la yang nyes pa byed pa ste /
translated: If you have committed an offense against the saṅgha, you have committed an offense against us as well.

original: rigs dman pa las rab tu byung bas kyang ston mnyes par byed na /
analyzed: rigs dman pa las rab tu byung bas kyang ston mnyes par byed na /
translated: Even those who have gone forth from a low caste can please the Teacher.

original: gre las skyes sh'a kya'i rigs las rab tu byung bas ci'i phyir mnyes par mi byed /
analyzed: gre las skyes sh'a kya'i rigs las rab tu byung bas ci'i phyir mnyes par mi byed /
translated: Why can't you, who have gone forth from the Śākya clan, please him?

original: dge slong ma dag gis khyod la phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa bcas kyis song la dge 'dun la bzod par gyis shig ces bya ba dang / des kyang bzod pa gsol du 'gro'o snyam du song ba las lam gyi bar du sbom dga' mos mthong ste 'phags pa phyag 'tshal lo gar bzhud ces smras pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong ma dag gis khyod la phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa bcas kyis song la dge 'dun la bzod par gyis shig ces bya ba dang / des kyang bzod pa gsol du 'gro'o snyam du song ba las lam gyi bar du sbom dga' mos mthong ste 'phags pa phyag 'tshal lo gar bzhud ces smras pa dang /
translated: Thinking, I will go and seek forgiveness, she went, but on the way, Thullanandā saw her and said, Noble lady, I prostrate to you. Where are you going?

original: des kyang bzod par gsol du 'gro zhes byas pa dang sbom dga' mos smras pa /🔽'phags pa sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung na da ni rigs tha dad rus tha dad las rab @48a * //
analyzed: des kyang bzod par gsol du 'gro zhes byas pa dang sbom dga' mos smras pa / 'phags pa sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung na da ni rigs tha dad rus tha dad las rab @48a * //
translated: She said, I am going to seek forgiveness. Thullanandā said,

original: tu byung ba rnams kyis rkang pa la 'dre ba mi bzang ngo //
analyzed: tu byung ba rnams kyis rkang pa la 'dre ba mi bzang ngo //
translated: Noble lady, since you have gone forth from the Śākya clan, it is not good for those who have gone forth from different clans and different families to touch your feet.

original: gre las skyes kyis smras pa srid mo dge 'dun gyis spangs pa'i las byas dge slong ma dag gis phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa phyin na ci ltar bya /
analyzed: gre las skyes kyis smras pa srid mo dge 'dun gyis spangs pa'i las byas dge slong ma dag gis phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa phyin na ci ltar bya /
translated: Kṣemā said, Sister, the saṅgha has performed the act of banishing you. Since the nuns have bound themselves not to prostrate to you, what should I do?

original: sbom dga' mos smras pa de dag yul thams cad nas spangs par gyur cig ;
analyzed: sbom dga' mos smras pa de dag yul thams cad nas spangs par gyur cig ;
translated: Thulsi said, “May they be expelled from all countries.”

original: khyod dge 'dun las spu bsnyal zhing 'byung ba dang nyes pa 'dor bar ma gsol cig /
analyzed: khyod dge 'dun las spu bsnyal zhing 'byung ba dang nyes pa 'dor bar ma gsol cig /
translated: “Do not ask the saṅgha to shave your hair and nails, to leave, and to be released from your offense.

original: bdag gis khyod la dge sbyong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i longs spyod kyis bsnyen bkur bya zhes smras pa dang / gre las skyes kyang 'dug go //
analyzed: bdag gis khyod la dge sbyong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i longs spyod kyis bsnyen bkur bya zhes smras pa dang / gre las skyes kyang 'dug go //
translated: I will serve you with the requisites and enjoyments of a renunciate.”🔽When she said this, Jāri remained silent.

original: de ltar gyur pa snga ma bzhin du ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snga ma bzhin du ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: As before, she told the Teacher what had happened.

original: bka' stsal pa dge slong ma khyod kyis sbom dga' mo la tshig 'jam pos bsgo shig /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa dge slong ma khyod kyis sbom dga' mo la tshig 'jam pos bsgo shig /
translated: “Bhikṣuṇī, you must speak to Thulsi with gentle words.”

original: dge slong ma dag gis de bzhin du bsgo na /
analyzed: dge slong ma dag gis de bzhin du bsgo na /
translated: The bhikṣuṇīs did as they were told.

original: 'di nyid ni bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes nga rgyal bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes nga rgyal bzung ste /
translated: “This is the truth, and the other is ignorance.”🔽She did not listen.

original: ma mnyan pa dang / de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: ma mnyan pa dang / de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: As before, she told the Teacher what had happened.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Teacher said,🔽“Bhikṣuṇī, you must speak to Thulsi with gentle words.”

original: dge slong ma khyod kyis sbom dga' mo la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo shig de dang 'dra ba gzhan yang ngo //🔽dge slong ma dag gis gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na yang 'di nyid bden pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma khyod kyis sbom dga' mo la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo shig de dang 'dra ba gzhan yang ngo // dge slong ma dag gis gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo na yang 'di nyid bden pa'o //
translated: “Bhikṣuṇī, you should order Thullanandā to do this with a four-part formal procedure.”

original: gzhan ni gti mug go zhes te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gti mug go zhes te /
translated: “The bhikṣuṇīs did order her with a four-part formal procedure, but she said, ‘This is the truth, and the rest is foolishness.’

original: de nyid la mthu bskyed cing snyem zhing mngon du bzung ste spyad pa dang de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: de nyid la mthu bskyed cing snyem zhing mngon du bzung ste spyad pa dang de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: She continued to insist on her position, and the bhikṣuṇīs reported this to the Teacher.

original: ston pas sbom dga' mo la khyod spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa bden nam /
analyzed: ston pas sbom dga' mo la khyod spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa bden nam /
translated: The Teacher asked Thullanandā, “Is it true that you are acting in this way?”🔽“Yes, Venerable One, it is true,” she replied.

analyzed: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //

translated: “The Saṅgha of monks” means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

analyzed: spang pa'i las byas par gyur zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //

analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ma'i dge 'dun no /

analyzed: spu snyol bar byed ces bya ba ni rtsa bting ba bzhin du byed pa'o //

translated: The phrase he will be expelled means that the Blessed One's Dharma is an expeller, not a non-expeller. The words he will be expelled are a form of endearment, a form of respect, and a form of reverence.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ste g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba 'debs zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang ni gang na mtshams bcad pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ste g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba 'debs zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang ni gang na mtshams bcad pa'i gnas so //
translated: The phrase he should request the lifting of restrictions while remaining within the boundary means that the boundary is the place where the boundary is determined.

original: sdig pa'i las ngan par spyod pa spong zhing phyin chad de lta bu mi byed par gsol ba 'debs pa ni g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las ngan par spyod pa spong zhing phyin chad de lta bu mi byed par gsol ba 'debs pa ni g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase he should request the lifting of restrictions means that he should request the abandonment of evil conduct and the non-performance of such actions in the future.

original: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes pa'am gzhan gyis de la bsgo bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis shes pa'am gzhan gyis de la bsgo bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase with full awareness means that he himself should be aware or that others should inform him.

original: 'phags pa khyod ces bya ba ni zhe sa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod ces bya ba ni zhe sa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase venerable is a form of address.

original: skra long long po dang rdud rdud por gyur te dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: skra long long po dang rdud rdud por gyur te dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la'o //
translated: The saṅgha is the saṅgha of disciples of the Tathāgata.

original: spu snyol bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: spu snyol bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not shave your head!

original: 'byung bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'byung bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not go forth!

original: phyag 'tshal bar ma ston cig /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal bar ma ston cig /
translated: Do not pay homage!

original: mtshams kyi nang du 'dug ste g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba ma 'debs shig ces bya ba ni slar bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du 'dug ste g-yo 'dor bar gsol ba ma 'debs shig ces bya ba ni slar bzlog pa'o //
translated: Do not request to enter the boundary and give up your deceit!

original: 'phags pa khyod la bdag gi lhung bzed dam zhes bya ba ni lcags sam sa'i lhung bzed sbyin no zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod la bdag gi lhung bzed dam zhes bya ba ni lcags sam sa'i lhung bzed sbyin no zhes zer ba'o //

original: chos gos zhes bya ba ni bal la sogs pa rnam bdun las gang yang rung ngo //
analyzed: chos gos zhes bya ba ni bal la sogs pa rnam bdun las gang yang rung ngo //
translated: A dharma robe is any of the seven types made of wool and so forth.

original: dra ba zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi snod do //
analyzed: dra ba zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi snod do //
translated: A net is a container for an alms bowl.

original: phor bu zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung du'o //
analyzed: phor bu zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung du'o //
translated: A cup is a small alms bowl.

original: ska rag ces bya ba ni rgya cang ngam lcags pod dam lhas @49b ma'o ;
analyzed: ska rag ces bya ba ni rgya cang ngam lcags pod dam lhas @49b ma'o ;
translated: A belt is a belt made of leather, cloth, or iron.

original: / ston pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa'i zur phyin pa'o //
analyzed: / ston pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa'i zur phyin pa'o //
translated: A teacher is one who has mastered the recitation.

original: klog pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa nyid do //
analyzed: klog pa zhes bya ba ni klog pa nyid do //
translated: “Reading” means reading itself.

original: kha ton zhes bya ba ni 'don du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton zhes bya ba ni 'don du 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Reciting” means making others recite.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: “Yoga” means one-pointed mind.

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
translated: “Mental attention” means śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs pa'o ;
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs pa'o ;
translated: “Should serve” means should give.

original: / ci dang cis brel bar ma gyur pa de dang des mi brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yo byad thams cad kyis stobs pa'o //
analyzed: / ci dang cis brel bar ma gyur pa de dang des mi brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yo byad thams cad kyis stobs pa'o //
translated: “With whatever is not troublesome” means giving all necessities.

original: dge slong ma des zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma des zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo'o //
translated: “That bhikṣuṇī” means Thullanandā.

original: dge slong ma rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Bhikṣuṇīs” means those who have entered this Dharma.

original: tshig 'jam po la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba yang gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshig 'jam po la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba yang gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The instruction with gentle words and so on is the same as above.

original: de la nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the faults there?

original: dge slong mas dge slong gang la la spang ba'i las byas pa de la yo byad kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong gang la la spang ba'i las byas pa de la yo byad kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs na nyes byas so //
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the nuns, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the nuns for a second time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the nuns for a third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the monks for a first time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gcig / gsol ba byed pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gnyis /
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos bsgo ba'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gcig / gsol ba byed pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gnyis /
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the monks for a second time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: las dang po pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gsum /🔽las gnyis pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po bzhi /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po gsum / las gnyis pa'i tshe mi gtong na sbom po bzhi /
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the monks for a third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a first time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a second time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: las gsum pa ma rdzogs par dngos po de gtong na legs /
analyzed: las gsum pa ma rdzogs par dngos po de gtong na legs /
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a fourth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: gal te mi gtong na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a fifth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a sixth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a seventh time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan na phas pham par 'gyur te /🔽spangs pa de dge slong yang yin /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan na phas pham par 'gyur te / spangs pa de dge slong yang yin /
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for an eighth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: dge 'dun rnams kyang de la phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa yang bcas de yang 'du shes /🔽dge slong de dge 'dun la 'byung bar gsol zhing bzod pa gsol bar 'dod pa yang yin /
analyzed: dge 'dun rnams kyang de la phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa yang bcas de yang 'du shes /🔽dge slong de dge 'dun la 'byung bar gsol zhing bzod pa gsol bar 'dod pa yang yin /
translated: If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a ninth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a tenth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for an eleventh time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a twelfth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a thirteenth time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽If she does not stop when pressed by the Sangha for a fourteenth time, she commits an offense

original: 'byung ba ma gsol cig ces kyang byas /🔽dge 'dun mas kyang de la de ltar ma byed cig ges bsgo /
analyzed: 'byung ba ma gsol cig ces kyang byas / dge 'dun mas kyang de la de ltar ma byed cig ges bsgo /
translated: And she said, Do not give rise to the elements.🔽The nun also admonished her, saying, Do not do that!

original: des dge 'dun gyis bka' yang bcag /
analyzed: des dge 'dun gyis bka' yang bcag /
translated: She said, I will disobey the Saṅgha.

original: las gsum rdzogs pa dang brgyad do //
analyzed: las gsum rdzogs pa dang brgyad do //
translated: When the three actions are complete, it is the eighth.

original: phas pham pa brgyad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: phas pham pa brgyad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eighth defeating offense is complete.

original: // /'phags ma dag bdag gis phas pham pa'i chos brgya po dag bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu zhing nyan pa'i 'khor rnams sphro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: // /'phags ma dag bdag gis phas pham pa'i chos brgya po dag bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu zhing nyan pa'i 'khor rnams sphro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Noble ones, I have explained the eighty defeating offenses. This is the conclusion, and it generates enthusiasm in the listening assembly.

original: dge slong mas nyes pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na thog ma ji lta ba phyis kyang de bzhin phas pham pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong mas nyes pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na thog ma ji lta ba phyis kyang de bzhin phas pham pa yin te /
translated: If a nun commits any of those offenses, just as it was at the beginning, so it is later. It is a defeating offense,

original: dge slong ma rnams dang lhan cig gnas shing spyod du mi dbang gis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la nyes pa de @50a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams dang lhan cig gnas shing spyod du mi dbang gis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la nyes pa de @50a * //
translated: and she is not allowed to live and practice together with the nuns. She should not live with them.

original: dag las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa brgyad las gang yang rung ba zhig byas pa'o //
analyzed: dag las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa brgyad las gang yang rung ba zhig byas pa'o //
translated: Among those offenses, any means any of the eight defeating offenses.

original: thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa brgyad las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na ji ltar sngon rab tu ma byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe khyim pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni phas pham pa brgyad las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na ji ltar sngon rab tu ma byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe khyim pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: As before, so later means that if one commits any of the eight defeating offenses, one is a layperson as before, just as one was before going forth and before higher ordination.

original: nga yang sngon bzhin du khyim pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽kha cig na re thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ston pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nga yang sngon bzhin du khyim pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // kha cig na re thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ston pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: I am a layperson as before.🔽Some say: As before, so later means that if one commits any of the eight defeating offenses when the Teacher was living in the world,

original: brgyad po de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na phas pham par gsungs pa de de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byas pa rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de skad bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na phas pham par gsungs pa de de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byas pa rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de skad bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: one is a layperson as before, just as one was before going forth and before higher ordination.

original: yongs su dag pa 'dri ba ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra bas 'dir yang bshad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa 'dri ba ni gleng gzhi'i skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra bas 'dir yang bshad pa ma byas so //
translated: The question of complete purity is similar to the explanation in the nidana chapter and is not explained here.

original: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa sngar phye ba'i dang po ste /
analyzed: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa sngar phye ba'i dang po ste /
translated: The bases of downfall are taught.

original: phas pham pa'i sde bshad pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: phas pham pa'i sde bshad pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the class of defeats is complete.

original: // / da 'dir ni ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa lngar phye ba'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / da 'dir ni ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa lngar phye ba'i rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Now, here, the bases of downfall are taught.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the class of partial defeats of the Saṅgha,

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos nyi shu ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos nyi shu ste /
translated: there are twenty partial defeats of the Saṅgha of fully ordained nuns.🔽In brief:🔽The matchmaker, the one without roots,🔽the third, the one with a little bit,

original: mdor na / smyan dang rtsa ba med pa dang // gsum po bag tsam yod pa dang // bzhi po de ni chung zad yin //
analyzed: mdor na / smyan dang rtsa ba med pa dang // gsum po bag tsam yod pa dang // bzhi po de ni chung zad yin //
translated: the fourth, the one with a little bit,

original: lnga po chags pa med pa ste //
analyzed: lnga po chags pa med pa ste //
translated: the fifth, the one without attachment,🔽the sixth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the seventh, the one who is not a friend,🔽the eighth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the ninth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the tenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the eleventh, the one who is not a friend,🔽the twelfth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the thirteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the fourteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the fifteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the sixteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the seventeenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the eighteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the nineteenth, the one who is not a friend,🔽the twentieth, the one who is not a friend.

original: mtshan mo nyin par lam dag dang // klung gi pha rol btang ba dang // shi ba'i chags pa len pa dang // dge slong ma yi bzod byed dang // sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // dad pa zhe sdang 'jigs pa dang// gnyis po 'dus pas sbyor ba dang //
analyzed: mtshan mo nyin par lam dag dang // klung gi pha rol btang ba dang // shi ba'i chags pa len pa dang // dge slong ma yi bzod byed dang // sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // dad pa zhe sdang 'jigs pa dang// gnyis po 'dus pas sbyor ba dang //
translated: with faith, aversion, and fear,🔽and when both are gathered,

original: de yi rjes su phyogs byed do //
analyzed: de yi rjes su phyogs byed do //
translated: one should apply oneself.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe bcu gnyis sde mo dag bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig gis smyan byed par zhugs pa dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis dge sbyong ma 'dis ni skyo mi shes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcu gnyis sde mo dag bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig gis smyan byed par zhugs pa dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis dge sbyong ma 'dis ni skyo mi shes te /
translated: At that time, the group of twelve engaged in matchmaking for women with men's words and for men with women's words. The brahmins and householders said, This ascetic does not know how to be satisfied.

original: bud med la skyes ba'i tshig gis smyan byed bram ze dang khyim bdag gi bud med kyang de ltar smyan byed na /
analyzed: bud med la skyes ba'i tshig gis smyan byed bram ze dang khyim bdag gi bud med kyang de ltar smyan byed na /
translated: She matches women with men's words and men with women's words. The brahmin and householder women also matchmake like this.

original: de dag bram ze dang khyim bdag gi bud med rnams dang khyad ci yod /
analyzed: de dag bram ze dang khyim bdag gi bud med rnams dang khyad ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between them and the wives of the brahmins and householders?

original: de dag la su zhig bsod snyoms sbyin par spro zhes smod cing @50b mi snyen par 'dzer to //
analyzed: de dag la su zhig bsod snyoms sbyin par spro zhes smod cing @50b mi snyen par 'dzer to //
translated: Who would be willing to give alms to them?”

original: de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol ba dang / bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol ba dang / bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the Teacher was informed of this situation, he said,

original: bcu gnyis sde la khyod kyis smyan byas pa bden nam /
analyzed: bcu gnyis sde la khyod kyis smyan byas pa bden nam /
translated: “Is it true, as they say, that you acted as a matchmaker?”

original: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: btsun pa mad do zhes gsol nas /
translated: “Yes, it is true, Bhadanta.”

original: rnam grangs du mas smad de /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas smad de /
translated: He censured them in many ways and

original: nyan thos ma rnams kyi phyir 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: nyan thos ma rnams kyi phyir 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: for the sake of the nuns, he laid down a training rule in the Monastic Law.

original: yang dge slong ma gang bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig gis chung ma 'am mdza' na mor smyan byed na tha na skad cig pa de nyid kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig gis chung ma 'am mdza' na mor smyan byed na tha na skad cig pa de nyid kyang rung ste /
translated: “If a nun acts as a matchmaker for a woman by using the words of a man or for a man by using the words of a woman, even if it is just for a moment,

original: chos 'di ni thog ma nyid kyis ltung bar 'gyur la 'byung bar byas te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: chos 'di ni thog ma nyid kyis ltung bar 'gyur la 'byung bar byas te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: this nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

original: nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of certainty:

original: bdag po nges pa dang / dngos po nges pa dang / dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po nges pa dang / dngos po nges pa dang / dus nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the master, the certainty of the thing, and the certainty of the time.

original: de la bdag po nges pa ni gcig la gcig 'phrin skyel ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag po nges pa ni gcig la gcig 'phrin skyel ba'o //
translated: The certainty of the master is the mutual delivery of messages.

original: dngos po nges pa ni skyes pa dang bud med do //
analyzed: dngos po nges pa ni skyes pa dang bud med do //
translated: The certainty of the thing is a man and a woman.

original: dus nges pa na thi na skad cig phrad pa'o //
analyzed: dus nges pa na thi na skad cig phrad pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the time is the moment of the meeting.

original: dge slong ma gang zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis sde ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma gang zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis sde ste /
translated: “A bhikṣuṇī” means a member of the group of twelve.

original: de dang 'dra ba gzhan yang ngo ;
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba gzhan yang ngo ;
translated: It also means another like her.

original: / bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig ces bya ba ni gcig la dus 'phrin skye la zhing dus 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: / bud med la skyes pa'i tshig dang / skyes pa la bud med kyi tshig ces bya ba ni gcig la dus 'phrin skye la zhing dus 'debs pa'o //
translated: “The words of a man to a woman and the words of a woman to a man” means that in one place the time is delivered and in another place the time is received.

original: chung ma 'am mdza' na mo zhes bya ba ni chung ma bdun dang mdza' na mo bcu'o //
analyzed: chung ma 'am mdza' na mo zhes bya ba ni chung ma bdun dang mdza' na mo bcu'o //
translated: “A wife or a lover” means seven wives and ten lovers.

original: chung ma bdun gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chung ma bdun gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the seven wives? They are:

original: chu las byin pa dang / nor gyis nyos pa dang ; rgyal mtshan gyis 'phrogs pa dang / dga' bas gnas pa dang / dgab pas gnas pa dang / mnyam du 'tsho ba dang / de'i skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: chu las byin pa dang / nor gyis nyos pa dang ; rgyal mtshan gyis 'phrogs pa dang / dga' bas gnas pa dang / dgab pas gnas pa dang / mnyam du 'tsho ba dang / de'i skad cig pa'o //
translated: the one who is given in marriage for water, the one who is given in marriage for wealth, the one who is given in marriage by a banner, the one who is given in marriage for fun, the one who is given in marriage for protection, the one who is given in marriage for a living, the one who is given in marriage for a short time, and the one who is given in marriage for a moment.

original: mdza' na mo bcu la pha dang ma dang / ming po dang / phu nu mo dang / sgyug mo dang / g-yos po dang / gnyen dang rigs dang / rus kyis bsrungs pa dang / 'khrugs pa med pa can dang bcu'o //
analyzed: mdza' na mo bcu la pha dang ma dang / ming po dang / phu nu mo dang / sgyug mo dang / g-yos po dang / gnyen dang rigs dang / rus kyis bsrungs pa dang / 'khrugs pa med pa can dang bcu'o //
translated: There are ten kinds of women who are protected by relatives: the one who is protected by her mother, the one who is protected by her father, the one who is protected by her mother and father, the one who is protected by her brother, the one who is protected by her sister, the one who is protected by her relatives, the one who is protected by her family, the one who is protected by her lineage, the one who is protected by her clan, and the one who is protected by the threat of punishment.

original: mas bsrungs pa'i mdza' na mo gang zhe na /
analyzed: mas bsrungs pa'i mdza' na mo gang zhe na /
translated: What is a woman who is protected by her mother?

original: bud med gzhon nu ma gang khyim thab dus las 'das sam /
analyzed: bud med gzhon nu ma gang khyim thab dus las 'das sam /
translated: It is a young woman whose husband has died,

original: smyos sam / sems 'khrugs sam /
analyzed: smyos sam / sems 'khrugs sam /
translated: or who has gone mad, or who has lost his mind,

original: dgra'i yul lam /
analyzed: dgra'i yul lam /
translated: or who has gone to a foreign land,🔽or who has run away and is hiding.

original: gzhan du bros bar gyur nas de ma'i drung na gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan du bros bar gyur nas de ma'i drung na gnas te /
translated: She lives with her mother,

original: de la gzhan zhugs kyis dogs pa'i phyir bsrungs shin tu bsrungs sbas /
analyzed: de la gzhan zhugs kyis dogs pa'i phyir bsrungs shin tu bsrungs sbas /
translated: and she is protected by her mother because of the fear that another might have intercourse with her.

original: shin tu sbas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbas pa'o //
translated: She is well protected, well guarded, and well hidden.

original: ming pos bsrungs pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ming pos bsrungs pa'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The same applies up to the one who is protected by her sister.

original: sgyug mo dang / g-yos pos bsrungs pa ni pha ma dang khyim thab dus las 'das pa yang snga ma bzhin no //🔽gnyen gyis bsrungs pa ni @51a * //
analyzed: sgyug mo dang / g-yos pos bsrungs pa ni pha ma dang khyim thab dus las 'das pa yang snga ma bzhin no // gnyen gyis bsrungs pa ni @51a * //
translated: The mother-in-law and the cook are like the mother and the husband.

original: rabs bdun tshun chad kyi rigs su gnas pa ni gnyen no //
analyzed: rabs bdun tshun chad kyi rigs su gnas pa ni gnyen no //
translated: The relatives are those who are related by blood up to the seventh generation.

original: de phan chad ni gnyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni gnyen ma yin no //
translated: Those who are beyond that are not relatives.

original: rigs kyis bsrungs pa ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rigs kyis bsrungs pa ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The family is of four types.

original: rus kyis bsrungs pa ni koo sya dang / bad sya dang / goo ta ma la sogs te /
analyzed: rus kyis bsrungs pa ni koo sya dang / bad sya dang / goo ta ma la sogs te /
translated: The clan is the Kauśika, the Bhadrika, the Gautama, etc.

original: pha ma dang / khyim thab dus 'das pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: pha ma dang / khyim thab dus 'das pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The husband is the one who has the same mother and father as the monk.

original: 'khrul pa med pa ni mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong ngam khyim thab gcig las gzhan mi tshol ba 'am mu stegs kyi dge bsnyen yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa ni mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong ngam khyim thab gcig las gzhan mi tshol ba 'am mu stegs kyi dge bsnyen yang rung ba'o //
translated: The non-erroneous is the heretic ascetic or the one who does not seek another husband, or the heretic upāsaka.

original: chos zhes bya ba chos ma yin pa de chos kyi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba chos ma yin pa de chos kyi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The Dharma is that which is not Dharma, but is called by the name of Dharma.

original: thog ma nyid kyi ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byas ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid kyi ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni byas ma thag tu'o //
translated: The first transgression is the one that is committed immediately.

original: dbyung bar bya ba ni 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbyung bar bya ba ni 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is expelled is the expeller.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du gyur dge 'dun la rag las dge 'dun gyi dbang bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du gyur dge 'dun la rag las dge 'dun gyi dbang bya ba ste /
translated: The term “remainder of the Saṅgha” means that the Saṅgha is the master, the Saṅgha is the one to whom one is subject, the Saṅgha is the one who has power over one.

original: ltung ba 'di la dge 'dun gyis dbyung bar 'gyur gyi gang zag ma yin zhing pas pham pa brgyad ni lhag ma ma lus /
analyzed: ltung ba 'di la dge 'dun gyis dbyung bar 'gyur gyi gang zag ma yin zhing pas pham pa brgyad ni lhag ma ma lus /
translated: This downfall is removed by the Saṅgha, not by an individual.

original: 'di ni dge 'dun gyis gso ba'i lhag ma lus pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun gyis gso ba'i lhag ma lus pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is a remainder of the Saṅgha because the Saṅgha heals it, and it is a remainder because it is not completely gone.🔽What is the downfall?

original: de la ltung ba gang zhe na bdag nyid kyis 'phrin blangs la bdag nyid kyis bzlugs pa /🔽bdag nyid kyis bskyal ba'am /🔽dge slong ma bdag nyid kyis 'phrin blangs /🔽'phrin pa la bzlugs /
analyzed: de la ltung ba gang zhe na bdag nyid kyis 'phrin blangs la bdag nyid kyis bzlugs pa / bdag nyid kyis bskyal ba'am / dge slong ma bdag nyid kyis 'phrin blangs / 'phrin pa la bzlugs /
translated: If a monk himself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a nun,🔽or if a nun herself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a monk,🔽or if a monk himself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a messenger,🔽or if a nun herself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a messenger,

original: 'phrin pa la bskyal ba 'am /
analyzed: 'phrin pa la bskyal ba 'am /
translated: or if a messenger himself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a monk or nun,

original: 'phrin pa 'ba' zhig las gong ma bzhin du byas pa dang / yang 'phrin gyi bar du lan gsum gyi tha mar lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrin pa 'ba' zhig las gong ma bzhin du byas pa dang / yang 'phrin gyi bar du lan gsum gyi tha mar lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: or if a messenger himself accepts a message, delivers it, and conveys it to a monk or nun, then, as in the above cases, this is a partial defeat.

original: dbang yod pa las 'phrin blangs pa yang lan gsum gyi tha mar lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang yod pa las 'phrin blangs pa yang lan gsum gyi tha mar lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, if one accepts a message from one who has power, it becomes a remainder after the third time.

original: dbang med pa la 'phrin blangs /
analyzed: dbang med pa la 'phrin blangs /
translated: If one accepts a message from one who does not have power,

original: dbang med pa la bzlugs /
analyzed: dbang med pa la bzlugs /
translated: if one conceals it for one who does not have power,🔽and if one delivers a message to one who has power, there are two offenses of wrong conduct and one serious violation.

original: dbang yod pa la lan bskyal na nyes byas gnyis dang / sbom po gcig / dge slong mas dbang med pa la 'phrin blangs /
analyzed: dbang yod pa la lan bskyal na nyes byas gnyis dang / sbom po gcig / dge slong mas dbang med pa la 'phrin blangs /
translated: If a fully ordained nun accepts a message from one who does not have power,

original: de la bzlugs de la lan bskyal na nyes byas gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bzlugs de la lan bskyal na nyes byas gsum ste /
translated: conceals it, and delivers it, there are three offenses of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The rest is to be applied in the same way.

original: chung ma dang po gsum 'thabs pa las bsdums pa la rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: chung ma dang po gsum 'thabs pa las bsdums pa la rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven ways of reconciling the first three types of wives who are fighting:

original: 'thabs ma thag pa bsdums na nyes byas gcig /
analyzed: 'thabs ma thag pa bsdums na nyes byas gcig /
translated: If one reconciles them immediately after they have started to fight, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: cung zad lon pa bsdums na nyes byas gnyis /
analyzed: cung zad lon pa bsdums na nyes byas gnyis /
translated: If one reconciles them after a short time, there are two offenses of wrong conduct.

original: rtsa bcad pa la nyes byas gsum rdo bor ba la nyes byas gsum dang sbom po gcig / brtsad pa la nyes bya gsum dag sbom po gnyis /
analyzed: rtsa bcad pa la nyes byas gsum rdo bor ba la nyes byas gsum dang sbom po gcig / brtsad pa la nyes bya gsum dag sbom po gnyis /
translated: If one reconciles them after they have cut off their hair, there are three offenses of wrong conduct. If one reconciles them after they have thrown away their stones, there are three offenses of wrong conduct and one serious violation. If one reconciles them after they have argued, there are three offenses of wrong conduct and two serious violations.

original: chung ma ma yin pa zhes bsgrags pa la nyes byas gsum sbom po gsum @51b lhag ma gcig / dril brdungs pa las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po bzhi lhag ma gnyis /
analyzed: chung ma ma yin pa zhes bsgrags pa la nyes byas gsum sbom po gsum @51b lhag ma gcig / dril brdungs pa las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po bzhi lhag ma gnyis /
translated: If she is a nun, there are three offenses of wrong conduct, four serious violations, and two remaining offenses.

original: chung ma bzhi dang mdza' na mo bcu ni 'thabs ma thag tu bsdums na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ma bzhi dang mdza' na mo bcu ni 'thabs ma thag tu bsdums na lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If she is one of the four wives or ten types of female companions, it is a remaining offense if they reconcile immediately after the fight.

original: dge slong ma khyim pa'i der song ste /🔽bu mo 'di ci'i phyir bag mar mi gtong zhe 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma khyim pa'i der song ste / bu mo 'di ci'i phyir bag mar mi gtong zhe 'am /
translated: If a nun goes to a householder and asks,🔽“Why don’t you give this girl in marriage?”

original: khye'u 'di'i chung ma ci'i phyir mi blang zhe na /🔽khye'u 'di gyos sgyug gi khyim du ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes byas rung /
analyzed: khye'u 'di'i chung ma ci'i phyir mi blang zhe na / khye'u 'di gyos sgyug gi khyim du ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes byas rung /
translated: or, “Why don’t you take a wife for this boy?”🔽or, “Why doesn’t this boy go to his in-laws’ house?”🔽or, “Why doesn’t this girl go to her husband’s house?”

original: bu mo 'di khyim thab kyi khyim du ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes dris na nyes byas su 'gyur /
analyzed: bu mo 'di khyim thab kyi khyim du ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes dris na nyes byas su 'gyur /
translated: it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yan lag bzhis lhag mar 'gyur te mi'i bud med dbyad bzod pa sngar ma 'dus pa 'dus par yang gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhis lhag mar 'gyur te mi'i bud med dbyad bzod pa sngar ma 'dus pa 'dus par yang gyur pa'o //
translated: If she uses all four limbs, it is a remaining offense if she brings together a human female who is able to bear children and who has not been brought together before.

original: lhag ma dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag ma dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first chapter on remaining offenses is completed.

original: // / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe sbom dga' mos 'thab pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / rtsod pa'i tshe dge slong ma rnams la rtsa ba med par phas pham pa'i chos kyis skur par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbom dga' mos 'thab pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / rtsod pa'i tshe dge slong ma rnams la rtsa ba med par phas pham pa'i chos kyis skur par byed de /
translated: At that time, Thullanandā, during disputes, quarrels, and arguments, slandered the nuns with the unchaste act of root downfall.

original: des na dge slong ma rnams bag 'chums pa dang spa gong par gyur pas klag pa dang kha ton dang yid la bya ba rnams nyams par gyur te mi dga' zhing 'khod do //
analyzed: des na dge slong ma rnams bag 'chums pa dang spa gong par gyur pas klag pa dang kha ton dang yid la bya ba rnams nyams par gyur te mi dga' zhing 'khod do //
translated: Because of that, the nuns became timid and frightened. Their recitation, chanting, and mental work declined. They lived unhappily.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: When this happened, they requested the Teacher, and he established a rule of training.

original: yang dge slong ma gang zhe sdang can zhig khros nas gnod par byed de ji nas kyang 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas dge slong ma gtsang ma ma nyes pa la rtsa ba med par phas pham pa'i chos kyis skur pa las de dus
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang zhe sdang can zhig khros nas gnod par byed de ji nas kyang 'di tshangs par spyod pa dang dbral lo snyam nas dge slong ma gtsang ma ma nyes pa la rtsa ba med par phas pham pa'i chos kyis skur pa las de dus
translated: “Also, if a nun, out of anger, harms a pure, innocent nun, thinking, ‘I will separate her from the pure life,’ and slanders her with the unchaste act of root downfall,

original: gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur la /
translated: If you ask another, or if you do not ask, that dispute will be without basis.

original: dge slong ma yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhig pas khros te smras so zhe na yang chos 'di gnyis kyis ltung bar gyur la 'byung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma yang zhe sdang la gnas pa zhig pas khros te smras so zhe na yang chos 'di gnyis kyis ltung bar gyur la 'byung bar bya ste /
translated: If you say, The nun was angry and spoke out of hatred, then by these two dharmas you will fall into an offense and it will be a ground for rehabilitation.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: It is a pārājika.

original: yang dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' ma'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' ma'o //
translated: As for nun, it refers to Śubhaṅkarā.

original: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: As for hatred, it refers to anger.

original: khros nas gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs te 'khrug pa ma btong ngo //
analyzed: khros nas gnod par byed ces bya ba ni yi ma rangs te 'khrug pa ma btong ngo //
translated: As for angry, she did harm, it means that she was displeased and did not let go of her anger.

original: ci nas kyang 'di tshang par spyod pa dang dral blo snyam zhes bya ba'i ci nas kyang 'di dge sbyong gi las 'brel par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'di tshang par spyod pa dang dral blo snyam zhes bya ba'i ci nas kyang 'di dge sbyong gi las 'brel par byed pa'o //
translated: As for how can I make her lose her livelihood and be expelled from the community? it means how can I make her lose her connection with the work of a śramaṇa.

original: dge slong ma gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //🔽nyes pa med ces bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o // nyes pa med ces bya ba ni ltung ba ma byung ba'o //
translated: As for a pure nun, it refers to one who has entered this Dharma.🔽As for without fault, it means without offense.

original: rtsa ba med par @52a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba med par @52a * //
translated: As for without basis, it means without cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: This means without seeing, hearing, or suspecting.

original: phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad po las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad po las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Defeat” means any of the eight.

original: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa la chos kyi sgrar bsgrags so //
analyzed: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa la chos kyi sgrar bsgrags so //
translated: “Dharma” means what is not Dharma is proclaimed as Dharma.

original: skur ba zhes bya ba ni slang btang ba'o //
analyzed: skur ba zhes bya ba ni slang btang ba'o //
translated: “Falsely” means without ground.

original: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyis zhig na'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na zhes bya ba ni dus phyis zhig na'o //
translated: “At another time” means later.

original: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: “Whether asked” means by another.

original: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'gyod pa skyes nas rab tu 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'gyod pa skyes nas rab tu 'gyod pa'o //
translated: “Or not asked” means oneself, having given rise to regret, is very remorseful.

original: rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa de yang rtsa ba med par gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: “That dispute also becomes groundless” means there are four types of disputes:

original: 'khrug pa'i rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pa'i rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i rtsod pa dang / mi 'doms pa'i rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i rtsod pa'o //
translated: disputes of contention, disputes of non-rebuke, disputes of downfall, and disputes of action.

original: rtsa ba med ces bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba med ces bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: “Groundless” is as above.

original: dge slong ma yang zhes sdang la gnas zhes bya ba ni skur ba gad pa par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma yang zhes sdang la gnas zhes bya ba ni skur ba gad pa par 'dod pa'o //
translated: A nun, too, is one who is angry, etc.

original: khro zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: khro zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The one who is angry is the one who is reviling.

original: chos 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: This Dharma is as above.

original: thog ma nyid kyis ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung ma thag pas so //
analyzed: thog ma nyid kyis ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung ma thag pas so //
translated: She becomes guilty of a downfall from the very beginning means that she becomes guilty as soon as the downfall occurs.

original: dbyung bar bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbyung bar bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: She is to be expelled means that she is to be expelled.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The remainder of the verse is as above.

original: de ltung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall?

original: dge slong ma gtsang ma la skur na rnam pa bcus ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma gtsang ma la skur na rnam pa bcus ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a nun who is pure is reviled, she becomes guilty of a downfall in ten ways.

original: rnam pa lngas na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If she is not pure, she becomes guilty in five ways.

original: dge slong ma mi gtsang ba la skur na rnam pa bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma mi gtsang ba la skur na rnam pa bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a nun who is pure is reviled, she becomes guilty of a downfall in eleven ways.

original: rnam pa drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If she is not pure, she becomes guilty in six ways.

original: de la gtsang ma la skur na bcus nyes par 'gyur ba ni des ma mthong ma thos mi dogs par 'du shes sbas nas mthong thos dogs zhes zer ba dang / sngon thos pa dang dogs pa las brjed nas ngas thos nas ngas thos dogs te ma brjed do zhes zer ba dang /
analyzed: de la gtsang ma la skur na bcus nyes par 'gyur ba ni des ma mthong ma thos mi dogs par 'du shes sbas nas mthong thos dogs zhes zer ba dang / sngon thos pa dang dogs pa las brjed nas ngas thos nas ngas thos dogs te ma brjed do zhes zer ba dang /
translated: one says, “I did not forget that I heard or suspected it,” when one has forgotten what one heard or suspected;🔽one says, “I saw it,” when one has heard it and believes what one has heard;🔽one says, “I saw it,” when one has heard it but does not believe what one has heard;🔽one says, “I saw it,” when one has suspected it;🔽one says, “I saw it,” when one has not suspected it;

original: thos la yid ches pa dang / thos la yid ma ches par mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / thos la dogs pa dang / thos la mi dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhes pa dang / dogs la dogs bzhin du ngas ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba rnam pa bcu gang ltar smras na yang rung ste /
analyzed: thos la yid ches pa dang / thos la yid ma ches par mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / thos la dogs pa dang / thos la mi dogs par ngas mthong ngo zhes pa dang / dogs la dogs bzhin du ngas ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba rnam pa bcu gang ltar smras na yang rung ste /
translated: one says, “I did not see it,” when one has suspected it.

original: re re la yang lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re re la yang lhag ma re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: In each of these cases, there is an additional fault.
