translated: and went to Śrāvastī. They told the Teacher what had happened and left.

analyzed: de nas dge slong ma dga' mo la sogs pas bsams pa gang sa nyid las gred pa de ni sa nyid la brten te ldang ngo //
translated: Then Nandā and the other nuns thought, “Those who fell from the earth will rise up in dependence on the earth.

analyzed: bdag cag kyang ston pa dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la bzod par gsol lo zhes mnyan du yod par dong ste phyin pa dang ston pas bka' stsal pa bzhin du dge slong ma dag kyang khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge slong ma dag gis phyag byas pa dang
translated: We too will ask the Teacher and the community of nuns for forgiveness.” They went to Śrāvastī. When they arrived, the Teacher said, “Just as the nuns who corrupted the householders bowed to the nuns,

translated: The others do not speak to us because of our pride.🔽We and you have done the same work of defiling the householders' houses. Why do you not speak to us?

original: mdzes dga' mo dang bdag cag gis khyim sun 'byin pa'i las byas par 'dra na khyed cag ci'i phyir bdag cag la mi smra de dag gis smras pa khyed zer ba yang bden mod kyis /

translated: What you say is true, but🔽we have confessed our faults and will not practice evil with you.

analyzed: nged kyis nyes pa bshags zin pas na gnas ngan len khyed dang lhan cig mi spyad do zhes bya ba dang / de dag gis smras pa 'di na dge slong ma kha cig ni 'di 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang 'jigs pas 'gro ste /
translated: Here some nuns go out of desire, hatred, delusion, and fear,

analyzed: nyes pa 'dra ba las kha cig ni bskrad kha cig ni ma bskrad ces bya ba dang / de ltar @64a * //

analyzed: gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /

original: tshig 'jam pos bsgo shig ces bya ba nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos bsgo shig ces bya ba nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: dge slong ma gang zhig grong ngam grong rdal zhig na gnas shing 'khod pa de dag kyang rigs sun pa dang / sdig pa'i chos kun tu spyod de /

analyzed: de dag rigs sun par snang ngam thos sam rab tu shes sam de dag gis sdig pa'i chos kyang kun tu spyod par snang ngam thos sam rab tu shes na dge slong ma de dag la dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong ma khyed rigs sun pa dang
translated: and if they see, hear, or know that they are engaging in vile actions, those nuns should be told by the nuns, ‘Nuns, you are defiling families

analyzed: / sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod de /
translated: and engaging in vile actions.

original: khyed kyis rigs sun par snang ngo ;

original: / thos so //

analyzed: dge slong ma khyed 'di na gnas pas chog gis gnas 'di nas deng shig ces de skad bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “You should tell them, ‘Bhikṣuṇīs, it is not suitable for you to live here. You should leave this place.’

analyzed: gal te de dag dge slong ma rnams la 'di na dge slong ma kha cig ni 'dod pas 'gro'o //
translated: “If they say to the bhikṣuṇīs, ‘Some bhikṣuṇīs live here out of desire,

analyzed: zhe sdang gis 'gro'o // gti mug gis 'gro'o //
translated: some out of anger,🔽some out of ignorance,

analyzed: gal te mi gtong na ni chos 'di yang lan gsum du dbyung bar bya ste dge 'dun lhag ma'o //

analyzed: thos so rab tu shes so zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

translated: Just as leaves of different trees are carried away by the wind and collected together, in the same way, you have gone forth from different clans and families.🔽Whether you are virtuous

analyzed: 'phags ma khyod dag mi nyan pa'i las kyi mtha' 'di lta bu thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong ma de la dge slong ma rnams kyis de skad bsgo na /

analyzed: dge slong ma gang zhes bya ba ni ti sha ste /

analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin can du gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “She becomes one who is of disagreeable speech” means

analyzed: bstan par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni ltung bas sde lnga la bya'o //

analyzed: yang na mdo sde kun bstan pa 'am /

analyzed: dge slong ma dag gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //

analyzed: bdag kyang 'phags ma dag la dge yang rung sdig kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Noble ones, whether it is good or bad means

original: sdig pa las mi ldog ste /
analyzed: sdig pa las mi ldog ste /
translated: Do not discourage me from what is bad.🔽Do not speak to me at all means that for my own sake, I block the path of others' words.

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi phyir gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pas spong bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: tshig gi lam bzlog shig ces bya ba ni zhi bar byos shig nga la rjes su ston par khyed sus bsgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means, “Who has appointed you to instruct me?”

original: smras pa chog go zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du smras pas @66a * //
analyzed: smras pa chog go zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du smras pas @66a * //
translated: “Enough!” means, “What is the use of speaking like this?

original: bdag la 'tshe ci dgos chog go //
analyzed: bdag la 'tshe ci dgos chog go //
translated: What is the use of harming me? Enough!

original: khyed cag nyid la phan pa la 'jug par gyis shig / gzhan la glengs te ci bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag nyid la phan pa la 'jug par gyis shig / gzhan la glengs te ci bya zhes pa'o //
translated: You should engage in benefiting yourselves. What is the use of gossiping about others?”

original: dge slong ma de la zhes bya ba ni ti sha'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma de la zhes bya ba ni ti sha'o //
translated: “That nun” means Tiṣya.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba man chad ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba man chad ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: “The nuns” and so on is as explained above.

original: lhag ma nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag ma nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The twenty-first remaining case is complete.🔽“Noble ones, I have explained the twenty remaining rules for the Saṅgha.

original: // /'phags ma dag bdag gis dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos nyi shu po dag bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu zhing spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: // /'phags ma dag bdag gis dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos nyi shu po dag bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu zhing spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: ” This is the conclusion and encouragement.

original: bcu gnyis ni nyes pa dang po de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bzlog kyang rung ma bzlog kyang rung /
analyzed: bcu gnyis ni nyes pa dang po de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis bzlog kyang rung ma bzlog kyang rung /
translated: The twelfth is by that very first offense,

original: byas ma thag tu nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas ma thag tu nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the offense is established immediately after it is committed, whether the Saṅgha stops it or not.🔽The eighth is up to three times,

original: brgyad pa ni lan gsum gyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum dang bslab pa gtong ba nas bka' blo mi bde ba'i bar brgyad po rnams ni dge 'dun gyis bzlog ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni lan gsum gyi bar du'o zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum dang bslab pa gtong ba nas bka' blo mi bde ba'i bar brgyad po rnams ni dge 'dun gyis bzlog ste /
translated: because the Saṅgha stops the eight offenses from the three jewels up to not accepting advice,

original: mi ldog na lan gsum pa'i tshig tshogs ma thag tu dge 'dun gyis bka' bcag pas nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldog na lan gsum pa'i tshig tshogs ma thag tu dge 'dun gyis bka' bcag pas nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the offense is established immediately after the third statement is made by the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong ma de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyes pa las dbyung ba'i chos rnams ston te /
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyes pa las dbyung ba'i chos rnams ston te /
translated: The teaching on the qualities of being released from an offense is shown by the words “those bhikṣuṇīs” and so forth.

original: 'di la yang rnam pa lngas bshad de /
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam pa lngas bshad de /
translated: This is also explained in five parts:

original: nyes pa dang / bsam pa dang / nyes pa'i chad pa'i las dang / spyad pa dang / gang zag bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: nyes pa dang / bsam pa dang / nyes pa'i chad pa'i las dang / spyad pa dang / gang zag bstan pa'o ;
translated: the offense, the attitude, the act of the punishment for the offense, the practice, and the person.

original: / de la nyes pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas de dag la nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhig byas la zhes bya ba yin te //
analyzed: / de la nyes pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas de dag la nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhig byas la zhes bya ba yin te //
translated: The phrase she is accused of an offense means that a nun has committed any kind of offense.

original: de dag las nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma nyi shu las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las nyes pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma nyi shu las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase any kind of offense means any of the twenty-two offenses entailing suspension.

original: bsam pa gtan pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du shes bzhin du bcas pa de srid du mi 'dod pa bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa gtan pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du shes bzhin du bcas pa de srid du mi 'dod pa bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase she is suspended means that she is suspended for as long as she conceals the offense.

original: de la ji srid du zhes bya ba ni zhag gam zla ba 'am lo yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de la ji srid du zhes bya ba ni zhag gam zla ba 'am lo yang rung ngo //
translated: The phrase for as long as she conceals it means for as long as she conceals the offense, whether it is a day, a month, or a year.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung yang nyes par mi shes sam dran pa nyams pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung yang nyes par mi shes sam dran pa nyams pa yang rung ste /
translated: The phrase in the same way means that, even though she has committed an offense, she does not know that it is an offense or has forgotten that she committed it.

original: bcabs pa'i sems med pas zhag 'das kyang de la mtshan mo bcabs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i sems med pas zhag 'das kyang de la mtshan mo bcabs pa'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because she does not have the intention to conceal the offense, even though she has passed the night, she does not incur the offense of concealing the offense during the night.

original: bcabs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo bcabs pa dang / sems kyis bcabs pa'o //
analyzed: bcabs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo bcabs pa dang / sems kyis bcabs pa'o //
translated: Concealed means concealed at night and concealed in the mind.

original: de la mtshan mo bcabs pa ni lhag ma byung na bcabs par sems bskyed de skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan mo bcabs pa ni lhag ma byung na bcabs par sems bskyed de skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
translated: In this case, concealed at night means that if a remainder occurs, one conceals it with the intention to conceal it until dawn.

original: sems kyis bcabs pa ni nyes @66b pa byung nas bcabs par sems bskyed gang la gang skya rengs kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis bcabs pa ni nyes @66b pa byung nas bcabs par sems bskyed gang la gang skya rengs kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: Concealed in the mind means that if a fault occurs, one conceals it with the intention to conceal it until one meets with someone.

original: skabs 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug pa ni 'di gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: skabs 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug pa ni 'di gnyi ga gzung ngo //
translated: In this context, both of these are to be taken as being forced to punish unwillingly.

original: bshags par 'dod pa las brjed de ma bshags na bcabs pa'i nyes pa med zhag res nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: bshags par 'dod pa las brjed de ma bshags na bcabs pa'i nyes pa med zhag res nyes byas re re'o //
translated: If one wishes to confess but forgets and does not confess, there is no fault of concealment.

original: 'on pa dang ; skad brda mi phrad pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du gnas pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / phas pham pa byung ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / khyim dang / dge tshul ma la sogs pa la mthol na mthol bar mi chud de bcabs pa'i nyes pa ni med /
analyzed: 'on pa dang ; skad brda mi phrad pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du gnas pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / phas pham pa byung ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / khyim dang / dge tshul ma la sogs pa la mthol na mthol bar mi chud de bcabs pa'i nyes pa ni med /
translated: If one confesses to a mute, to one who does not understand the language, to one who is outside the boundary, to one who is not a regular monk, to one who has committed a defeating offense, to one who has committed one of the five heinous actions, to a layperson, to a novice, and so on, then it is not considered confessed and there is no fault of concealment.

original: nyes byas ni yod do //🔽bcabs pa bshags par bsams pa las dran pa nyams sam /
analyzed: nyes byas ni yod do // bcabs pa bshags par bsams pa las dran pa nyams sam /
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one thinks to confess a fault but one's memory fails,

original: khyim par babs te slar dran pa rnyed cing rab tu byung na /🔽dran pa nyams pa dang / bcabs pa bkol te /
analyzed: khyim par babs te slar dran pa rnyed cing rab tu byung na / dran pa nyams pa dang / bcabs pa bkol te /
translated: or one becomes a layperson and later regains one's memory and again becomes a monk,🔽then one should confess the fault and the concealment.

original: snga phyi ji srid bcabs pa de'i chad pa byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: snga phyi ji srid bcabs pa de'i chad pa byed du gzhug go //
translated: One should be made to undergo the penalty for the concealment for as long as one concealed it, whether it was a long or short time.

original: lhag ma gnyis dus gcig tu byung ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis dus gcig tu byung ste /
translated: If two remaining offenses occur simultaneously,

original: zla ba gnyis bcabs pa las cig sngar mthol te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis bcabs pa las cig sngar mthol te /
translated: if one confesses one of them earlier,

original: chad pa zla ba gnyis tshang ba'i tshe cig shos kyang mthol na zla ba gnyis kyis chad pa de yang bral bar bya ste /
analyzed: chad pa zla ba gnyis tshang ba'i tshe cig shos kyang mthol na zla ba gnyis kyis chad pa de yang bral bar bya ste /
translated: If one who has been suspended for two months confesses at the same time as the other, then the suspension of both is lifted.

original: dus gcig tu mthol na yang chad pa zla ba gnyis su zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu mthol na yang chad pa zla ba gnyis su zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the suspension of both is exhausted by two months, even if they confess at the same time.

original: zla ba gnyis bcabs pa ji lta bar gzhan rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis bcabs pa ji lta bar gzhan rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: As it is for two months, so it is for the others.

original: gang nyes pa byung nas ji srid du bcabs pa'i zhag mi mngon pa des ni /
analyzed: gang nyes pa byung nas ji srid du bcabs pa'i zhag mi mngon pa des ni /
translated: From the day that a fault occurs until the day it is concealed,

original: gtsang ma'i mtha' nas bzung ste chad pa byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i mtha' nas bzung ste chad pa byed du gzhug go //
translated: one should be suspended from the end of the pure period.

original: nyes pa byung na bcabs pa las mthol nas snga ma'i chad pa byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nyes pa byung na bcabs pa las mthol nas snga ma'i chad pa byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When one who has concealed a fault confesses it and is suspended for the original period,

original: nyes pa snga ma dang 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba gzhan byung na chad pa snga ma blangs pa spang la bub ste /
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma dang 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba gzhan byung na chad pa snga ma blangs pa spang la bub ste /
translated: if another fault similar to the previous one or a different one occurs, the previous suspension is relinquished and one is suspended again.

original: chad pa gzhi nas blangs nas byed du gzhug ste /
analyzed: chad pa gzhi nas blangs nas byed du gzhug ste /
translated: Having taken up the suspension from the beginning, one should be suspended.

original: 'di ni gzhi nas blangs pa'i chad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi nas blangs pa'i chad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “suspension from the beginning.”

original: gal te chad pa de nyid byed pa'i tshe yang nyes pa byung na snga ma spang la bub ste /
analyzed: gal te chad pa de nyid byed pa'i tshe yang nyes pa byung na snga ma spang la bub ste /
translated: If the punishment is given and the fault occurs again, the former punishment is increased.🔽

original: yang chad pa gzhi nas bzlas te byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: yang chad pa gzhi nas bzlas te byed du gzhug go //
translated: If the person who is to be punished commits a new offense while being punished, the former punishment is canceled and he is to be punished again from the beginning.

original: 'di ni gzhi nas blangs pa bzlas pa'i chad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi nas blangs pa bzlas pa'i chad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “punishment from the beginning” for one who has been punished.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni mi btub na btang ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byed du gzhug ces bya ba ni mi btub na btang ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Punishment should be imposed unwillingly” means that if it is not possible, it is not a transgression to release the person.

original: gal te mi btub na gnyen po la mi brten pa'i phyir dgar ba'i las @67a * //
analyzed: gal te mi btub na gnyen po la mi brten pa'i phyir dgar ba'i las @67a * //
translated: If it is not possible, the person should be expelled because he is not relying on the antidote.

original: bya'o ; / chad pa ci zhig byed du gzhug ce na /🔽chad pa byed pa dang / mgu ba spyod pa gnyis ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / chad pa ci zhig byed du gzhug ce na / chad pa byed pa dang / mgu ba spyod pa gnyis ni 'dra'o //
translated: What kind of punishment should be imposed?🔽Punishment and pleasing are similar.

original: chad pa dang mgu ba byed pa'i tshul ni 'dra ste /
analyzed: chad pa dang mgu ba byed pa'i tshul ni 'dra ste /
translated: The method of punishment and pleasing is similar.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / phyag bya ba bdag gir mi bya /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / phyag bya ba bdag gir mi bya /
translated: One should not accept being natural, or being worshipped,

original: stan gcig la 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: stan gcig la 'dug par mi bya /
translated: or sitting on the same seat,

original: stan mtho ba 'am mnyam pa nyid la ma yin /
analyzed: stan mtho ba 'am mnyam pa nyid la ma yin /
translated: or sitting on a high or equal seat,

original: bstabs te 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: bstabs te 'dug par mi bya /
translated: or sitting in a place of honor,

original: mdun na 'chag par mi bya /
analyzed: mdun na 'chag par mi bya /
translated: or walking in front.

original: phyi nas 'gro ba'i dge spyong ma 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas 'gro ba'i dge spyong ma 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: A female novice should not go out alone.

original: g-yogs pa gcig gi nang du gnas par mi bya /🔽gzhan rab tu mi 'byung /🔽bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: g-yogs pa gcig gi nang du gnas par mi bya / gzhan rab tu mi 'byung / bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: She should not stay in a place with only one wall.🔽She should not give full ordination.

original: gnas bca' ba mi sbyin /🔽dge tshul bsdu ba'i las mi bya /
analyzed: gnas bca' ba mi sbyin / dge tshul bsdu ba'i las mi bya /
translated: She should not give formal support.🔽She should not perform the duties of a novice nun.

original: gsol ba la sogs pa'i las byed par mi bsko /
analyzed: gsol ba la sogs pa'i las byed par mi bsko /
translated: She should not be appointed to do such things as recite the confession of offenses.

original: dge slong ma rnams la gleng bar mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la gleng bar mi bya /
translated: She should not speak to the nuns.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa rnams kyis rkang ba bkru ba dang / sgo dbye ba dang / me mar 'byung ba dang / gtsug lag khang bsku ba dang / phyag dar bya ba dang / bshang gci sa'i wa bkru ba dang / sa dang lo ma dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa rnams kyis rkang ba bkru ba dang / sgo dbye ba dang / me mar 'byung ba dang / gtsug lag khang bsku ba dang / phyag dar bya ba dang / bshang gci sa'i wa bkru ba dang / sa dang lo ma dang /
translated: She should wash the feet of those who are present, open the door, light the lamps, sweep the temple, clean the toilets, and clean the leaves and earth.

original: grong dro bsal ba rlung yab kyis g-yab pa dang / mal stan sba ba dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong dro bsal ba rlung yab kyis g-yab pa dang / mal stan sba ba dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi bsal bar bya'o //
translated: She should fan the community with a palm-leaf fan to cool them, put away the bedding, and clean the floor.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi ni 'og / dge tshul ma rnams kyi gong du 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi ni 'og / dge tshul ma rnams kyi gong du 'dug par bya'o //
translated: All those who have received full ordination should sit below the novice nuns.

original: ston pa 'dug pa gsol zhing bstod pa dang / gand'i brdung bar bya ba dang / dri gtsang khang phyags pa dang / chag chag gdab pa dang / tshes grangs rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa 'dug pa gsol zhing bstod pa dang / gand'i brdung bar bya ba dang / dri gtsang khang phyags pa dang / chag chag gdab pa dang / tshes grangs rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: The duties of the rector are: to greet the teacher, to praise him, to beat the gandi, to sweep the temple, to sprinkle it with water, and to announce the dates.

original: chad pa dang mgu ba zhag tu spyad pa yang dge 'dun 'dus pa rnams la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chad pa dang mgu ba zhag tu spyad pa yang dge 'dun 'dus pa rnams la brjod par bya ste /
translated: The rector should inform the assembled community of the punishments and honors that have been carried out.

original: re re'i drung du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re re'i drung du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not in the presence of each individual.

original: chad pa dang mgu ba spyad pa yang ;🔽chad pa 'am mgu bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: chad pa dang mgu ba spyad pa yang ; chad pa 'am mgu bar byed pa'am /
translated: The punishments and honors should be carried out🔽either by the one who has punished or honored,

original: chad pa dang mgu bar bya ba byas zin pa 'am /
analyzed: chad pa dang mgu bar bya ba byas zin pa 'am /
translated: or by the one who has finished punishing or honoring,

original: bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du mi bya'i gang na rang bzhin du gnas pa yod pa der spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du mi bya'i gang na rang bzhin du gnas pa yod pa der spyad par bya'o //
translated: not in the midst of the community that has given the training, and so on, but where there are those who are naturally present.

original: 'di dbye ba mang mod kyis 'dir mdo tsam zhig bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dbye ba mang mod kyis 'dir mdo tsam zhig bstan to //
translated: Although there are many divisions, here only a brief explanation has been given.

original: nyes pa'i chad pa'i las bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byas nas de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gnyi ga mgu bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i chad pa'i las bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas mi 'dod bzhin du chad pa byas nas de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gnyi ga mgu bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The teaching on the act of punishment means that after a nun has been punished unwillingly, the two Sanghas should be satisfied.

original: chad pa dang mgu ba spyad pa'i tshul ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra bas ma bshad de /
analyzed: chad pa dang mgu ba spyad pa'i tshul ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra bas ma bshad de /
translated: The method of practicing punishment and satisfaction is the same as explained above, so it is not explained.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni chad pa byas pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni chad pa byas pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: After that means after the punishment.

original: dge 'dun gnyi ga zhes @67b bya ba ni dge slong pha'i dge 'dun dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gnyi ga zhes @67b bya ba ni dge slong pha'i dge 'dun dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The two Sanghas are the Sangha of monks and the Sangha of nuns.

original: mgu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed kyi bar du dge 'dun gnyi ga mgu bar byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: mgu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed kyi bar du dge 'dun gnyi ga mgu bar byos shig pa'o //
translated: Be satisfied means be satisfied with the two Sanghas for half a month.

original: spyod pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas mgu bar byas nas dbyung ba la thogs te chos dang mthun par byas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas mgu bar byas nas dbyung ba la thogs te chos dang mthun par byas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching on conduct means that after a nun has been satisfied, if she is obstructed from being expelled and acts in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de la dbyung ba la thogs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dug mdas phog pa ji srid du ma phyung ba de srid du mi bde ba dang 'dra bar nyes pa byas pa 'di yang dge 'dun gnyi gas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis ma phyung na
analyzed: de la dbyung ba la thogs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dug mdas phog pa ji srid du ma phyung ba de srid du mi bde ba dang 'dra bar nyes pa byas pa 'di yang dge 'dun gnyi gas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis ma phyung na
translated: The phrase is obstructed from being expelled means that just as a person who has been struck by a poisoned arrow is not happy until the arrow is removed, so too this person who has committed a downfall is not happy until the act of the community of both orders is performed to expel her.

original: yun ring por ngan song gsum du mi bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por ngan song gsum du mi bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For a long time she will experience various kinds of unhappiness in the three lower realms.

original: chos dang mthun par byas na zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung ba des ji srid du bcabs pa'i chad pa yang chos bzhin du bcad /
analyzed: chos dang mthun par byas na zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung ba des ji srid du bcabs pa'i chad pa yang chos bzhin du bcad /
translated: The phrase if she acts in accordance with the Dharma means that she has been punished in accordance with the Dharma for as long as she has concealed her downfall.

original: zla ba phyed kyi bar du dge 'dun gnyi ga la mgu ba yang chos bzhin du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi bar du dge 'dun gnyi ga la mgu ba yang chos bzhin du byas pa'o //
translated: She has acted in accordance with the Dharma to please the community of both orders for a period of one month.

original: gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang na dge 'dun gnyi ga'i tshogs bzhi bcu yod pa der dge slong ma de dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang na dge 'dun gnyi ga'i tshogs bzhi bcu yod pa der dge slong ma de dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase the individual is pointed out means that this nun is to be expelled from the place where the community of both orders of forty members is present.

original: dge 'dun gnyi ga las bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang bas gal te dge slong ma de phyung na dge slong ma de yang ma phyin pa dge 'dun gnyi ga yang smad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gnyi ga las bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang bas gal te dge slong ma de phyung na dge slong ma de yang ma phyin pa dge 'dun gnyi ga yang smad par 'gyur te /
translated: If that nun is expelled, then both communities are censured, because that nun is not expelled and both communities are incomplete.

original: de la ni dus yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la ni dus yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: In that case, it is the proper time.

original: de la gnyi ga'i tshogs bzhi bcu zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma yang nyi shu dge 'dun pha yang nyi shu ste de las nyung du mi gnang ba'i phyir bzhi bcu zhes smos par zad kyi de las lhag na brgya ste ci snyed kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga'i tshogs bzhi bcu zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun ma yang nyi shu dge 'dun pha yang nyi shu ste de las nyung du mi gnang ba'i phyir bzhi bcu zhes smos par zad kyi de las lhag na brgya ste ci snyed kyang rung ngo //
translated: In that case, the assembly of both is forty minus one.

original: dge slong ma de dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong ma de dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
translated: That nun should be expelled by the four-part formal procedure of announcement.

original: de yang ma phyin la bya ba'i nyes pa las so //
analyzed: de yang ma phyin la bya ba'i nyes pa las so //
translated: If she is not expelled, then there is the fault of not doing what is to be done.

original: smad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gnyi ga la 'das pa dang bcabs pa'i nyes byas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smad par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gnyi ga la 'das pa dang bcabs pa'i nyes byas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both communities are censured because both communities have the fault of transgressing and concealing.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa byung ba'i gang zag de la tshangs par 'gyur zhing nyes pa las phyin pa'i dus ni 'byin par byed pa'i chos sngar bstan pa las byung ba bzhin du byas pa yin no
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa byung ba'i gang zag de la tshangs par 'gyur zhing nyes pa las phyin pa'i dus ni 'byin par byed pa'i chos sngar bstan pa las byung ba bzhin du byas pa yin no
translated: The phrase this is the time for that means that the time for that person who has committed a partial defeat of the monks to be purified and to be released from his offense is when he has performed the rite of release as previously explained.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: gang zag chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: gang zag chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: There are six types of persons who practice punishment and reconciliation:

original: thams cad gnag pa dang / phal cher gnag pa dang / phyed gnag pa dang / phyogs gcig gnag pa dang / cung zad gnag pa dang / nag po @68a * //
analyzed: thams cad gnag pa dang / phal cher gnag pa dang / phyed gnag pa dang / phyogs gcig gnag pa dang / cung zad gnag pa dang / nag po @68a * //
translated: totally black, mostly black, half black, one quarter black, slightly black, and without black.

original: med pa'o // de la thams cad gnag pa ni chad pa rnam pa gsum dang / mgu ba rnam pa gsum dang / 'byung ba bdun te thams cad chos bzhin ma yin pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'o // de la thams cad gnag pa ni chad pa rnam pa gsum dang / mgu ba rnam pa gsum dang / 'byung ba bdun te thams cad chos bzhin ma yin pas byas pa'o //
translated: Totally black means that all three punishments, all three reconciliations, and the seven offenses are committed by a person who does not act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: phal cher gnag pa ni gang chad pa ni chos bzhin la gzhan drug po thams cad chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher gnag pa ni gang chad pa ni chos bzhin la gzhan drug po thams cad chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: Mostly black means that the punishment is in accordance with the Dharma, but the other six are not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: phyed gnag pa ni gnyis chos bzhin la /
analyzed: phyed gnag pa ni gnyis chos bzhin la /
translated: The half-black is like the two-part.

original: gzhan lnga po rnams chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan lnga po rnams chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: The other five are not like the Dharma.

original: phyogs gcig gnag pa ni gsum chos bzhin la bzhi chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gnag pa ni gsum chos bzhin la bzhi chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: The one-sided black is like the three-part, and the four-part is not like the Dharma.

original: cung zad gnag pa ni drug chos bzhin la /
analyzed: cung zad gnag pa ni drug chos bzhin la /
translated: The slightly black is like the six-part,

original: gcig chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: and the one-part is not like the Dharma.

original: nag po med pa ni tha ma'i dbyung ba yang chos bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: nag po med pa ni tha ma'i dbyung ba yang chos bzhin pa ste /
translated: The one without black is the last part, and it is like the Dharma.

original: de bas na nag po med pas ni nyes pa las byung ba yin gyi snga ma rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nag po med pas ni nyes pa las byung ba yin gyi snga ma rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one without black is arisen from fault, but the former ones are not.

original: gang zag rnam pa drug gis ni dge slong ma gcig gi mdun du bshags pas tshang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa drug gis ni dge slong ma gcig gi mdun du bshags pas tshang bar 'gyur te /
translated: By one person confessing in front of one nun, the six types of persons are completed.

original: drug gang zhe na mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo zad par 'dzin pa dang / shin tu ngo tsha yod de gang dag rkyen des 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan ma dang grags shing bsod nams che ba ste /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo zad par 'dzin pa dang / shin tu ngo tsha yod de gang dag rkyen des 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan ma dang grags shing bsod nams che ba ste /
translated: What are the six? The one who upholds the sutras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā; the one with great shame; the one who would die by that condition; the elder nun of the saṅgha; and the one with great fame and merit.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pas nyes pa las dbyung ba yin gyi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pas nyes pa las dbyung ba yin gyi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a restoration of the offense by means of a pure attitude, and not by means of a penalty.

original: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni go sla bas 'dir bshad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni go sla bas 'dir bshad pa ma byas so //
translated: The question of purification is easy to understand, so it is not explained here.

original: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa la sngar phye ba'i gnyis pa ste dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde'i bshad pa rnams rdzogs so /🔽// / ltung ba'i dngos po bstan pa la lngar phye ba'i gsum pa ste /
analyzed: ltung ba'i dngos po rnams bstan pa la sngar phye ba'i gnyis pa ste dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde'i bshad pa rnams rdzogs so / // / ltung ba'i dngos po bstan pa la lngar phye ba'i gsum pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the class of partial defeats, the second of the five classes of offenses that have been distinguished, is now complete.🔽The third of the five classes of offenses that have been distinguished is taught here:

original: ltung ba'i sde rnams 'dir ston to //
analyzed: ltung ba'i sde rnams 'dir ston to //
translated: The classes of downfalls.

original: 'di la yang gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: spang ba'i ltung ba dang / ltung ba'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba dang / ltung ba'o //
translated: downfalls that require rejection and downfalls.

original: de la spang ba'i ltung ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de la spang ba'i ltung ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: Downfalls that require rejection are the thirty-three.

original: ltung ba ni brgya brgyad cu ste /
analyzed: ltung ba ni brgya brgyad cu ste /
translated: Downfalls are the one hundred and eight.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the downfalls that require rejection,

original: mdor na / zhag bcur bcang dang bral bar mi bya dang // zla ba dang ni 'bru dang mi blang dang / gnyen min mi blang stod g-yogs dang // pags pa gnyis dang pho nya rin bskur ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mdor na / zhag bcur bcang dang bral bar mi bya dang // zla ba dang ni 'bru dang mi blang dang / gnyen min mi blang stod g-yogs dang // pags pa gnyis dang pho nya rin bskur ba'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should not take up the robe from a non-relative, or a robe with a lining, or two skins, or a messenger, or a gift.

original: de la zhag bcur bcang dang zhes bya ba ni ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de la zhag bcur bcang dang zhes bya ba ni ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: With regard to that, “One should not be separated from the robe for ten days” means: The Teacher was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe sbom dga' mo gos mang por gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbom dga' mo gos mang por gyur te /
translated: At that time, Bhadraka had many robes.

original: bsod snyoms la 'jug pa'i tshe gos gzhan @68b gyon te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la 'jug pa'i tshe gos gzhan @68b gyon te /
translated: When he went out for alms, he put on another robe.

original: de bzhin du zan za ba dang / mkhan mo dang / slob dpon gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe gos len re brje bas bya ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zan za ba dang / mkhan mo dang / slob dpon gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe gos len re brje bas bya ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur te /
translated: In the same way, when he ate food, when he went to the teacher and preceptor, and when he prostrated to the stūpa, he changed robes. He had many things to do.

original: dge ba sna tshogs kyi bar chad du gyur pas de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: dge ba sna tshogs kyi bar chad du gyur pas de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: Since it became an obstacle to various virtues, he asked the Teacher about this situation.

original: sbom dga' mo rnam pa du mas smad de bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: sbom dga' mo rnam pa du mas smad de bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The nuns criticized Thullanandā in many ways and reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong mas chos gos zin te /
analyzed: dge slong mas chos gos zin te /
translated: “A nun who has finished her robe

original: gtan pa phyung nas chos gos lnga chongs shig de las lhag par 'chang na spong ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gtan pa phyung nas chos gos lnga chongs shig de las lhag par 'chang na spong ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: should keep the five robes. If she keeps more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: de ltar ston pas bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang / khyim bdag gi bud med zhig gis bsams pa /
analyzed: de ltar ston pas bslab pa'i gnas bcas pa dang / khyim bdag gi bud med zhig gis bsams pa /
translated: After the Teacher had laid down this training rule, a certain householder’s wife thought,

original: skye dgu'i bdag mo ni lha dang mi'i mchod gnas yin na /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag mo ni lha dang mi'i mchod gnas yin na /
translated: “The head of the Sakyas is an object of worship for gods and humans.

original: de la bdag gis rin thang chen po'i gos shig bskon no snyam pa las /
analyzed: de la bdag gis rin thang chen po'i gos shig bskon no snyam pa las /
translated: I shall give her a very valuable robe.”

original: de'i tshe autpa la'i kha dog ma mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe autpa la'i kha dog ma mnyan du yod par bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
translated: At that time Utpalavarṇā was wandering for alms in Śrāvastī.

original: rim gyis bsod snyoms rgyu ba las /
analyzed: rim gyis bsod snyoms rgyu ba las /
translated: She went from house to house in order,

original: khyim bdag gi bud med de'i gan du phyin pa dang des phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bud med de'i gan du phyin pa dang des phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and she came to the householder’s wife. The householder’s wife bowed down to her and said,

original: 'phags ma skye dgu'i bdag mo gang na bzhugs /
analyzed: 'phags ma skye dgu'i bdag mo gang na bzhugs /
translated: “Noble one, where is the head of the Sakyas?”

original: des smras pa dbyar mo thang na'o //
analyzed: des smras pa dbyar mo thang na'o //
translated: “She is at Jātarūpa’s Park.”

original: khyim bdag gi bud med kyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bud med kyis smras pa /
translated: The householder’s wife said,

original: 'phags ma mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: 'phags ma mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Noble one, please understand this.

original: bdag gis yun ring mo nas bsams pa /
analyzed: bdag gis yun ring mo nas bsams pa /
translated: For a long time I have thought,

original: skye dgu'i bdag mo la rin thang chen po'i gos shig bskon snyam nas bdag cag khyim pa mo ni bya ba mang bas na /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag mo la rin thang chen po'i gos shig bskon snyam nas bdag cag khyim pa mo ni bya ba mang bas na /
translated: ‘I will give a very valuable piece of cloth to the head of the order of nuns.’ But we householders have many things to do,

original: 'phags mas gos 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo la bskon par ci gnang /
analyzed: 'phags mas gos 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo la bskon par ci gnang /
translated: so please, noble one, give this cloth to the head of the order of nuns.”

original: de nas autpa la'i kha dog mas bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas autpa la'i kha dog mas bsams pa /
translated: Then Utpalavaktra thought,

original: ma blangs na ni skye dgu'i bdag mo'i rnyed pa yang stor la /
analyzed: ma blangs na ni skye dgu'i bdag mo'i rnyed pa yang stor la /
translated: “If I don’t accept it, the head of the order of nuns will lose her gain,

original: bud med de'i bsod nams kyang 'gag par 'gyur snyam nas gos de blangs te skye dgu'i bdag mo'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: bud med de'i bsod nams kyang 'gag par 'gyur snyam nas gos de blangs te skye dgu'i bdag mo'i gan du song ste /
translated: and the merit of that woman will be cut off.” So she accepted the cloth, went to the head of the order of nuns,

original: de ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis ston pa la gsol nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis ston pa la gsol nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: and told her what had happened in detail. The nuns told the Teacher, and he said,

original: snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
translated: “The previous rule was a prohibition;

original: 'di ni gnang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba ste /
translated: this is a permission.

original: nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bca'o //
analyzed: nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bca'o //
translated: I establish a rule for the nuns:

original: dge slong mas gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas /
analyzed: dge slong mas gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas /
translated: If a fully ordained nun has finished her robe and the robe-making season has ended,

original: gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa ring na zhag bcu'i bar du chongs shig de las 'das par bcangs na spong ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa ring na zhag bcu'i bar du chongs shig de las 'das par bcangs na spong ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: she should keep the extra cloth for ten days at the most. If she keeps it longer than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong mas gos zin te gtan pa phyung @69a * //🔽zhes bya ba ni gos zin la gtan pa ma phyung ba yang yod /
analyzed: dge slong mas gos zin te gtan pa phyung @69a * // zhes bya ba ni gos zin la gtan pa ma phyung ba yang yod /
translated: If a fully ordained nun has finished her robe and the robe-making season has ended,🔽There are four possibilities regarding “having finished one’s robe” and “the robe-making season having ended”:

original: gtan pa phyung la gos ma zin pa yang yod /
analyzed: gtan pa phyung la gos ma zin pa yang yod /
translated: having finished one’s robe, but the robe-making season not having ended;🔽the robe-making season having ended, but not having finished one’s robe;

original: gos zin la gtan pa phyung ba yang yod /
analyzed: gos zin la gtan pa phyung ba yang yod /
translated: having finished one’s robe and the robe-making season having ended;

original: gos kyang ma zin la gtan pa yang ma phyung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gos kyang ma zin la gtan pa yang ma phyung ba yang yod do //
translated: neither having finished one’s robe nor the robe-making season having ended.

original: gos zin zhes bya ba ni bkrus drubs kha dog bsgyur ba'o ;
analyzed: gos zin zhes bya ba ni bkrus drubs kha dog bsgyur ba'o ;
translated: “Having finished one’s robe” means having washed, sewn, and dyed it.

original: / gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni tshul nas byung nas dge slong ma thams cad spyi'i gos gtan pa drubs nas /
analyzed: / gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni tshul nas byung nas dge slong ma thams cad spyi'i gos gtan pa drubs nas /
translated: “The robe-making season having ended” means that, having emerged from seclusion, the nuns have finished sewing the robe that is intended for all the nuns to use in common.

original: zla ba lnga yul rgyu zhing gos tshul du dong ba las zla ba lnga lon te phyir lhags nas spyi'i chos gos la gtan pa phyung nas /
analyzed: zla ba lnga yul rgyu zhing gos tshul du dong ba las zla ba lnga lon te phyir lhags nas spyi'i chos gos la gtan pa phyung nas /
translated: They then travel for five months, and after five months have passed, they return and emerge from the robe that is intended for all the nuns to use in common.

original: so so'i chos gos la sngags btab pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i chos gos la sngags btab pa'o //
translated: He should consecrate his own robes with the mantra.

original: zhag bcu zhes bya ba ni gos lhag rnyed pa nas bzung ste zhag bcu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu zhes bya ba ni gos lhag rnyed pa nas bzung ste zhag bcu'i bar du'o //
translated: Ten days means from the time of acquiring the extra robe up to ten days.

original: gos lhag ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: gos lhag ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa las lhag pa'o //
translated: Extra robe means more than what is consecrated.

original: rung bar ma byas zhes bya ba ni gos lhag gi sngags kyis ma btab pa'o //
analyzed: rung bar ma byas zhes bya ba ni gos lhag gi sngags kyis ma btab pa'o //
translated: Not made suitable means not consecrated with the mantra for an extra robe.

original: chongs shig ces bya ba ni bdag gis bya ba'o //
analyzed: chongs shig ces bya ba ni bdag gis bya ba'o //
translated: Keep it means it is to be done by oneself.

original: de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni de las thal ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par bcangs na zhes bya ba ni de las thal ba'o //
translated: If one keeps it beyond that means if one keeps it beyond that.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs la ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs la ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: A downfall that requires confession and relinquishment means that the article is to be relinquished and the downfall confessed.

original: zhag bcu la nyin re gos re re ste gos bcu rnyed na /
analyzed: zhag bcu la nyin re gos re re ste gos bcu rnyed na /
translated: If one acquires ten robes, one robe per day, for ten days,

original: thog ma rnyed pa'i gos zhag bcu 'das na de'i shugs kyis gzhan zhag ma tshang pa yang spang ngo //
analyzed: thog ma rnyed pa'i gos zhag bcu 'das na de'i shugs kyis gzhan zhag ma tshang pa yang spang ngo //
translated: if one passes ten days with the first robe that was acquired, by the force of that, the other robes that have not yet reached ten days must also be relinquished.

original: snga phyi gos re re zhig rnyed na phyi nas rnyed pa rung bar byas na /
analyzed: snga phyi gos re re zhig rnyed na phyi nas rnyed pa rung bar byas na /
translated: If one acquires a robe one after the other, if the last one is made suitable,

original: sngar rnyed par rung bar byos shig /
analyzed: sngar rnyed par rung bar byos shig /
translated: the first one must be made suitable.

original: sngar rnyed pa rung bar ma byas la zhag bcu 'das na snga ma ni spang /
analyzed: sngar rnyed pa rung bar ma byas la zhag bcu 'das na snga ma ni spang /
translated: If one does not make the former robe suitable, and ten days have passed, one must give up the former robe.

original: gos phyi ma rung bar byas pa ni spang mi dgos so //
analyzed: gos phyi ma rung bar byas pa ni spang mi dgos so //
translated: But one does not need to give up the latter robe that has been made suitable.

original: gos rgyu dang dbyibs brtags pa rnams ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la bsdo'o //
analyzed: gos rgyu dang dbyibs brtags pa rnams ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la bsdo'o //
translated: The rules for examining the material and the shape of the robe are to be applied to the preceptor and the master.

original: ma brtags pa rnams ni yon bdag la bsdo'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa rnams ni yon bdag la bsdo'o //
translated: The rules for examining the donor are to be applied to the benefactor.

original: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun dang dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor dang ma 'dres pa mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun gyi rdzas ni gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi dge slong la bsdo'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun dang dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor dang ma 'dres pa mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun gyi rdzas ni gtsug lag khang gzhan gyi dge slong la bsdo'o //
translated: The property of the Sangha of a particular region is to be applied to the monks of other monasteries.

original: ma bsdos te zhag bcu 'das na dge 'dun gyi rdzas spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bsdos te zhag bcu 'das na dge 'dun gyi rdzas spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not apply it and ten days have passed, one’s possession of the property of the Sangha becomes a downfall.

original: chos gos sngags kyis btab pa ni byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya /
analyzed: chos gos sngags kyis btab pa ni byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya /
translated: The consecration of a Dharma robe by means of a mantra is called “making it suitable.”

original: gos lhag sngags kyis btab pa ni rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste /🔽dge slong mas gos lhag ma spangs kyang bral bar ma byas /
analyzed: gos lhag sngags kyis btab pa ni rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste / dge slong mas gos lhag ma spangs kyang bral bar ma byas /
translated: The consecration of an extra robe by means of a mantra is called “making it suitable.”🔽A nun may have given up an extra robe, but not relinquished it.

original: bral bar byas kyang ltung ba ma bshags pa ste /
analyzed: bral bar byas kyang ltung ba ma bshags pa ste /
translated: She may have relinquished it, but not confessed the downfall.

original: de la gsum las gcig ma byas @69b kyang rung /
analyzed: de la gsum las gcig ma byas @69b kyang rung /
translated: There are three of these, and it is permissible to not do one of them.

original: gnyis dang gsum char ma byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gnyis dang gsum char ma byas kyang rung ste /
translated: It is also permissible to not do two or all three.

original: de'i shugs kyis ltung bzed dang / de'i snod dang / phor bu 'am /
analyzed: de'i shugs kyis ltung bzed dang / de'i snod dang / phor bu 'am /
translated: By the force of that, one should give up the begging bowl, the vessel, the water-pot,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: the belt,

original: dge sbyong gi yo byad gang yang rung /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi yo byad gang yang rung /
translated: or any of the ascetic’s requisites.

original: rdzas lhag spang ba byung ba'i sngon rol na sngags kyis ma thebs pa kun spang ngo //
analyzed: rdzas lhag spang ba byung ba'i sngon rol na sngags kyis ma thebs pa kun spang ngo //
translated: Before the arising of the relinquishment, all that is not enchanted should be given up.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first downfall of a novice nun is complete.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma rnams gos mang zhig rnyed par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma rnams gos mang zhig rnyed par gyur te /
translated: At that time, the nuns obtained a lot of cloth.

original: de dag gis gos de rnams bkrus drubs kha dog bsgyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis gos de rnams bkrus drubs kha dog bsgyur te /
translated: They washed the cloth, sewed it, dyed it,

original: gtur bu'i nang du bcug nas dge slong ma gzhi na 'khod pa rnams su gtams nas /
analyzed: gtur bu'i nang du bcug nas dge slong ma gzhi na 'khod pa rnams su gtams nas /
translated: put it in a basket, and filled it with the nuns who were staying there.

original: sham thabs dang bla gos bgos te /
analyzed: sham thabs dang bla gos bgos te /
translated: They put on their lower and upper robes,

original: ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba dang / lus ma yogs shing sha snang bar gyur la /
analyzed: ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba dang / lus ma yogs shing sha snang bar gyur la /
translated: and went wandering in the countryside, their bodies uncovered and their flesh visible.

original: dge slong ma gzhi na 'khod pa dag kyang de dag gi gos skems /
analyzed: dge slong ma gzhi na 'khod pa dag kyang de dag gi gos skems /
translated: The nuns who were staying there dried,

original: 'ding / sprug /
analyzed: 'ding / sprug /
translated: spread out, beat,🔽and stored their robes.

original: sdud cing sbed pas na bya ba dang byed pa mang bas dge ba'i bar chad du gyur te /
analyzed: sdud cing sbed pas na bya ba dang byed pa mang bas dge ba'i bar chad du gyur te /
translated: Because of the many things they had to do, they were interrupted in their virtuous activities.

original: don nyung ba'i dge slong ma rnams 'phya ste /
analyzed: don nyung ba'i dge slong ma rnams 'phya ste /
translated: The nuns who had few concerns criticized them,

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: and when they told the Teacher what had happened,

original: gso dka' ba dang dgang dka' ba'i nyes pas smad nas nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: gso dka' ba dang dgang dka' ba'i nyes pas smad nas nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: he scolded them for their faults, which were difficult to cure and difficult to fill, and he laid down a rule for the nuns.

original: dge slong mas gos zin la gtan pa phyung nas gal te nub gcig chos gos lnga las chos gos gang yang rung ba las mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas gos zin la gtan pa phyung nas gal te nub gcig chos gos lnga las chos gos gang yang rung ba las mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun who has finished her robes removes her storage seal and, except for one night, is separated from any of her five robes outside the boundaries, it is a downfall.

original: de ltar bslab pa'i gnas bcas nas ston pa rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de ltar bslab pa'i gnas bcas nas ston pa rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
translated: After laying down this training rule, the Teacher stayed at Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na skye dgu'i bdag mo rgyal po'i khab dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang rgyal po'i kun dga' zhes bya ba na 'dug go //
analyzed: de'i tshe na skye dgu'i bdag mo rgyal po'i khab dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang rgyal po'i kun dga' zhes bya ba na 'dug go //
translated: At that time, Mahāprajāpatī was staying at Rājagṛha in the nunnery called Rājagṛha Summer Retreat.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi tshe /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo bco lnga'i gso sbyong gi tshe /
translated: Then, on the occasion of the fortnightly confession of the fifteen nuns,

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun dang gso sbyong la 'dus shing 'dug go //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun dang gso sbyong la 'dus shing 'dug go //
translated: the nuns were assembled and sitting for the confession.

original: dge slong ma chos sbyin ma yang gso sbyin gyi gnas su song ba las chu bo dbyar bzangs brug pas sbyar ma gsher te skam pa la ring du thogs te /
analyzed: dge slong ma chos sbyin ma yang gso sbyin gyi gnas su song ba las chu bo dbyar bzangs brug pas sbyar ma gsher te skam pa la ring du thogs te /
translated: The nun Dharmadinnā went to the place of confession, but the river Sīta overflowed and she was delayed on the way.

original: gso sbyin gyi gnas su song ste phyin pa dang gnas brtan ma dag gis bdag cag ni khyod ma 'ongs pa la ring zhig thogs so zhes byas pa dang / chos sbyin mas kyang ji lta bur gyur pa smras nas /
analyzed: gso sbyin gyi gnas su song ste phyin pa dang gnas brtan ma dag gis bdag cag ni khyod ma 'ongs pa la ring zhig thogs so zhes byas pa dang / chos sbyin mas kyang ji lta bur gyur pa smras nas /
translated: When she arrived at the place of confession, the elder nuns said, “We have been waiting for you for a long time.” Dharmadinnā told them what had happened.

original: 'phags ma rnams bdag ni rgas te /
analyzed: 'phags ma rnams bdag ni rgas te /
translated: “Noble ones, I am old.🔽Since my legs are heavy, I am unable to walk. What should I do?”

original: sbyar ma lci bas bkur mi nus na ji ltar bgyi gyis shig ces smras pa dang / de ltar gyur pa @70a * //
analyzed: sbyar ma lci bas bkur mi nus na ji ltar bgyi gyis shig ces smras pa dang / de ltar gyur pa @70a * //
translated: If I cannot carry it because it is too heavy, what should I do?🔽 🔽Do it this way.

original: ston pa la gsol nas dge slong ma chos sbyin ma rgas pa sbyar ma dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i sdom pa byin cig ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: ston pa la gsol nas dge slong ma chos sbyin ma rgas pa sbyar ma dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i sdom pa byin cig ces bka' stsal te /
translated: The Teacher was entreated and he said, “Give the vow of not separating from the upper and lower robes to the nun Dharmadinnā who is old.”

original: de bas na snga ma ni bcas 'dan gnang ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na snga ma ni bcas 'dan gnang ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the former was a permission.

original: de ltar na nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos ma rnams la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Thus, the precepts were established for the nuns.

original: dge slong ma gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas gal te chos gos lnga las gang yang rung ba zhig nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas gal te chos gos lnga las gang yang rung ba zhig nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If a nun who has received the upper and lower robes, if she is separated from any of the five robes for one night outside the boundaries, except if the Saṅgha has given permission, it is a pāyattika offense.

original: gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Has received the upper and lower robes” is as before.

original: chos gos lnga zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang / stod chags dang / nang g-yogs dang / gong lugs dang / rdul gzan no //
analyzed: chos gos lnga zhes bya ba ni sbyar ma dang / stod chags dang / nang g-yogs dang / gong lugs dang / rdul gzan no //
translated: “The five robes” are the upper robe, the lower robe, the chest wrap, the upper shirt, and the dust cloth.

original: nub gcig ces bya ba ni zhag gcig gi skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
analyzed: nub gcig ces bya ba ni zhag gcig gi skya rengs kyis chod pa'o //
translated: “For one night” means separated by the dawn of one day.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol zhe bya ba ni grong shing thags kyis bskor ba'i mtshams ni shing thags nas glang drug gis 'dren pa'i 'od ma'i shing rta'i khor yug dang bya gag 'phur ba chun chad do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol zhe bya ba ni grong shing thags kyis bskor ba'i mtshams ni shing thags nas glang drug gis 'dren pa'i 'od ma'i shing rta'i khor yug dang bya gag 'phur ba chun chad do //
translated: The outer boundary of the village is the boundary of the village surrounded by a wall. The boundary of the village surrounded by a hedge is the circumference of a cart drawn by six oxen, the distance a crow can fly in three seconds.

original: grong rtsig pas bskor ba'i grong ni ba lang dang / lug gi mig rdul gar babs pa tshun chad dang / rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha ba bshang gci skyel ba tshun chad do //
analyzed: grong rtsig pas bskor ba'i grong ni ba lang dang / lug gi mig rdul gar babs pa tshun chad dang / rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha ba bshang gci skyel ba tshun chad do //
translated: The boundary of the village surrounded by a moat is the distance a cow or a sheep can see the dust of the village.

original: 'obs kyis bskor ba'i grong ni 'obs nas skas khru bcu gnyis pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: 'obs kyis bskor ba'i grong ni 'obs nas skas khru bcu gnyis pa tshun chad do //
translated: The boundary of the village surrounded by a ditch is the distance of twelve cubits from the ditch.

original: yang na phyag dar gyi phung po'i steng nas bong ba 'dril nas gar phyin pa tshun chud do //
analyzed: yang na phyag dar gyi phung po'i steng nas bong ba 'dril nas gar phyin pa tshun chud do //
translated: Or, it is the distance a ball thrown from the top of a pile of rubbish travels.

original: tshong 'dus kyi grong ni tshong pa spun ma bgos pa'i tshong dus kyi phyi nas 'dom gang tshun chad do //
analyzed: tshong 'dus kyi grong ni tshong pa spun ma bgos pa'i tshong dus kyi phyi nas 'dom gang tshun chad do //
translated: The boundary of a marketplace is the distance of one fathom from the marketplace where merchants who are not related do business.

original: gru ni phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad dang yang na phur pa btab ste gru 'dogs pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: gru ni phyi rol 'dom gang tshun chad dang yang na phur pa btab ste gru 'dogs pa tshun chad do //
translated: The boat is the area within one fathom of the shore or the area within one fathom of the boat's anchor.

original: shing drung ni lo ma rlung gis bskyod de gar ltung ba dang / thigs pa zags pa'i sa dang / nyi ma phyed nas grib ma nyi ma gar 'khor ba tshun chad do //
analyzed: shing drung ni lo ma rlung gis bskyod de gar ltung ba dang / thigs pa zags pa'i sa dang / nyi ma phyed nas grib ma nyi ma gar 'khor ba tshun chad do //
translated: The tree is the area within the range of the leaves shaken by the wind, the area where the drops of water fall, and the area within the range of the shadow from noon to midday.

original: 'brog dgon pa ni 'dom gang tshun chad mtshams so //
analyzed: 'brog dgon pa ni 'dom gang tshun chad mtshams so //
translated: The wilderness is the area within one fathom of the boundary.

original: shing phal mo che'i ni lo ma 'dres nas mtshams ma phye ba tshun chad do //
analyzed: shing phal mo che'i ni lo ma 'dres nas mtshams ma phye ba tshun chad do //
translated: The majority of trees are the area within the boundary where the leaves are mixed and the boundary is not distinguished.

original: ma 'brel ba la ni 'dom gang tshun chad do //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba la ni 'dom gang tshun chad do //
translated: The unconnected is the area within one fathom.

original: 'dron pa lam du zhugs pa ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do //
analyzed: 'dron pa lam du zhugs pa ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do //
translated: The caravan on the road is the area within forty-nine fathoms.

original: mtshams kyi bar du ni chos gos kyi mtha' lus dang ma bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar du ni chos gos kyi mtha' lus dang ma bral bar bya'o //
translated: Within the boundary, one should not be separated from the end of the robe.

original: mtshams de rnams kyi phyi rol du chos gos lus la bdag nang du 'dug gam bdag phyi rol na 'dug @70b la chos gos nang du lus te zhag gcig gi skya rengs kyis chod na spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams de rnams kyi phyi rol du chos gos lus la bdag nang du 'dug gam bdag phyi rol na 'dug @70b la chos gos nang du lus te zhag gcig gi skya rengs kyis chod na spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the robe is outside the boundaries and the monk is inside or outside the boundaries, and the robe is inside the boundaries, then if the night is interrupted by dawn, there is a transgression.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni gnang ba bkol ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni gnang ba bkol ba'o //
translated: Except with the permission of the saṅgha means the permission of the saṅgha is to be applied for.

original: spangs pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs ta ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po spangs ta ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: A downfall that is to be confessed means a downfall that is to be confessed after having given up the object.

original: spang ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: The second downfall that requires confession is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma rnams gos sngon po zhig rnyed na de mi langs te bzhag nas nam 'di 'dra ba zhig rnyed na gdod gos bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma rnams gos sngon po zhig rnyed na de mi langs te bzhag nas nam 'di 'dra ba zhig rnyed na gdod gos bya'o snyam mo //
translated: At that time, when the nuns obtained a blue cloth, they did not use it. They put it aside, thinking, “When we obtain one like this, we will make a robe.”

original: sngon po ji lta ba bzhin du ser po dang / dmar po dang / sdug po dang / srab mo yang ngo //
analyzed: sngon po ji lta ba bzhin du ser po dang / dmar po dang / sdug po dang / srab mo yang ngo //
translated: Just as with blue, so it was with yellow, red, and thin.

original: gang su yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang su yang rung ste /
translated: Whoever

original: chos gos tshol bas bya ba dang / byed pa mang bas dge ba'i bar chad du gyur nas /
analyzed: chos gos tshol bas bya ba dang / byed pa mang bas dge ba'i bar chad du gyur nas /
translated: Because of seeking robes, there are many activities, and that becomes an obstacle to virtue.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Having asked the Teacher about this situation, he established a rule of training.

original: dge slong mas chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas dus ma yin pa'i gos rnyed la 'dod na dge slong ma des gos de longs shig /
analyzed: dge slong mas chos gos zin te gtan pa phyung nas dus ma yin pa'i gos rnyed la 'dod na dge slong ma des gos de longs shig /
translated: “If a nun has finished her robe and has released her determination, and if she obtains out-of-season cloth, if she wishes for it, that nun should accept the cloth.

original: blangs nas gal te langs na ni myur du gos su drubs te chongs shig /
analyzed: blangs nas gal te langs na ni myur du gos su drubs te chongs shig /
translated: Having accepted it, if she has need of it, she should quickly have it made into a robe and keep it.

original: khal te ma langs na gos kha ma langs par rnyed du re ba yod na dge slong ma des gos de zla ba gcig gi bar du zhog shig /
analyzed: khal te ma langs na gos kha ma langs par rnyed du re ba yod na dge slong ma des gos de zla ba gcig gi bar du zhog shig /
translated: If she has no need of it, if she is expecting to get cloth for a robe, that nun should keep that cloth for a month at most.

original: de las 'das par bzhag na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'das par bzhag na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If she keeps it longer than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: dge slong mas chos gos zin la gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong mas chos gos zin la gtan pa phyung zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “If a nun has finished her robe and has released her determination” is as above.

original: dus ma yin pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni gtan pa bting na ston zla tha chungs nas dpyid zlar ba nya'i bar du zla ba lnga ni dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i gos zhes bya ba ni gtan pa bting na ston zla tha chungs nas dpyid zlar ba nya'i bar du zla ba lnga ni dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The term improper cloth means that if the cloth is spread out, the five months from the last month of autumn to the full moon of the first month of spring are called the proper time.

original: de phan chad ni dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de phan chad ni dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: After that, it is improper.

original: gtan pa ma bting na thams cad kyang dus ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan pa ma bting na thams cad kyang dus ma yin no //
translated: If the cloth is not spread out, then all of it is improper.

original: gos rnyed du re ba yod na zhes pa ni ma dang pha dang ming po dang phu nu mo dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang dus ston gyi tshe rnyed du re ba'o //
analyzed: gos rnyed du re ba yod na zhes pa ni ma dang pha dang ming po dang phu nu mo dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang dus ston gyi tshe rnyed du re ba'o //
translated: If there is hope of obtaining cloth, means that it is hoped to be obtained from one's mother, father, brother, sister, preceptor, teacher, or at a festival.

original: kha ma langs zhes bya ba ni chos gos lnga'i kha mi langs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha ma langs zhes bya ba ni chos gos lnga'i kha mi langs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term not cut means that the edges of the five robes are not cut.

original: spangs pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ltung ba bshags pa las dngos po spang ba'o //
analyzed: spangs pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni ltung ba bshags pa las dngos po spang ba'o //
translated: The term offense of abandonment means that the thing is abandoned in the confession of offenses.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: tshes gcig la gos shig rnyed la re med dam snon mi rnyed du dogs na byin gyis rlobs shig /🔽yang na rung bar gyis shig /
analyzed: tshes gcig la gos shig rnyed la re med dam snon mi rnyed du dogs na byin gyis rlobs shig / yang na rung bar gyis shig /
translated: If one obtains cloth on the first day and there is no hope of more, or if one fears that one will not obtain more, one should consecrate it.🔽Or one should make it suitable.

original: yang na bskur cig /
analyzed: yang na bskur cig /
translated: Or one should send it to another.

original: yang na gzhan la byin cig /
analyzed: yang na gzhan la byin cig /
translated: Or give it to someone else.

original: de ltar ma byas na tshes bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //🔽tshes gcig la gos shig nyed na tshes bcu gcig @71a * //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na tshes bcu gcig gi skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung ba'o // tshes gcig la gos shig nyed na tshes bcu gcig @71a * //
translated: If you do not do that, then when the dawn of the eleventh day has risen, it is a downfall that requires confession.

original: la gos phyi ma rnyed na snga ma'i shugs kyis zhag bcur sdod du mi snang ngo //
analyzed: la gos phyi ma rnyed na snga ma'i shugs kyis zhag bcur sdod du mi snang ngo //
translated: If you buy a robe on the first day, and obtain a later robe on the eleventh day, it is not permissible to keep the former robe for ten days.

original: kha langs pa ser po zhig rnyed du re ba las phyis kha dog mi mthun pa zhig rnyed na zla ba gcig tu sdod du mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: kha langs pa ser po zhig rnyed du re ba las phyis kha dog mi mthun pa zhig rnyed na zla ba gcig tu sdod du mi gnang ngo //
translated: If you are expecting to obtain a yellow robe, but later obtain one of a different color, it is not permissible to keep it for one month.

original: gnyi ga kha ma langs pa rnyed du re ba yod na zla ba gcig tu gnang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga kha ma langs pa rnyed du re ba yod na zla ba gcig tu gnang ngo //
translated: If you are expecting to obtain both a yellow robe and a white one, it is permissible to keep it for one month.

original: gos la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gos la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of robes:

original: bdag po yod pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / song nas phyir 'ongs pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po yod pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / song nas phyir 'ongs pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa'o //
translated: those belonging to someone else, those belonging to no one, those obtained after going to a place, those from a charnel ground, and those from a rubbish heap.

original: chos gos sbyar ma gsar ba ni nyis rim du sbyar /
analyzed: chos gos sbyar ma gsar ba ni nyis rim du sbyar /
translated: A new sewn robe is sewn with two layers.

original: rnying pa ni bzhi rim du sbyar /
analyzed: rnying pa ni bzhi rim du sbyar /
translated: An old one is sewn with four layers.

original: tshem bu ni du yang rung ngo //
analyzed: tshem bu ni du yang rung ngo //
translated: It is permissible to sew it with as many layers as you like.

original: snam bu dgu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gsum pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: snam bu dgu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gsum pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'o //
translated: The ninth, eleventh, and thirteenth are the third half-mandala.

original: bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth, seventeenth, and nineteenth are the fourth half-mandala.

original: nyi shu gcig dang nyi shu gsum pa dang nyi shu lnga pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang lnga'o //
analyzed: nyi shu gcig dang nyi shu gsum pa dang nyi shu lnga pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang lnga'o //
translated: The twenty-first, twenty-third, and twenty-fifth are the fifth half-mandala.

original: snam bu nyid shu lnga las lhag na tshem bu'o //
analyzed: snam bu nyid shu lnga las lhag na tshem bu'o //
translated: If the cloth is more than twenty-five cubits, it is a patchwork.

original: zhing khru gsum dang chur khru lnga'o ;
analyzed: zhing khru gsum dang chur khru lnga'o ;
translated: The field is three cubits and the width is five cubits.

original: / yang na khru phyed dang lnga dang phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: / yang na khru phyed dang lnga dang phyed dang gsum mo //
translated: Or it is four and a half cubits and three and a half cubits.

original: lnga pa na zhing khru gsum chur khru lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga pa na zhing khru gsum chur khru lnga'o //
translated: In the fifth, the field is three cubits and the width is five cubits.

original: yang khru phyed dang gsum dang chur bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang khru phyed dang gsum dang chur bzhi'o //
translated: Or it is three and a half cubits and four cubits.

original: 'khor gsum yod pa des kyang chud do //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yod pa des kyang chud do //
translated: If it has three borders, it is also valid.

original: spang ba gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The third abandonment is complete.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das dga' ldan gnas nas rnam pa lnga la gzigs te /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das dga' ldan gnas nas rnam pa lnga la gzigs te /
translated: The Blessed Bodhisattva, from the Tushita heaven, looks at five aspects.

original: rigs dang yul dang rus dang dus dang bud med la gzigs nas yul gyi dbus ser skya /
analyzed: rigs dang yul dang rus dang dus dang bud med la gzigs nas yul gyi dbus ser skya /
translated: He was born in the central country of Kapilavastu,

original: yab zas gtsang ma /
analyzed: yab zas gtsang ma /
translated: his father was Shuddhodana,

original: yum sgyu ma'i lha mo'i lhums su gshegs nas btsas pa'i nyin mo mnyan du yod par rgyal po au ra tshangs pas byin gyi bu gsal rgyal dang / rgyal po'i khab tu padma chen po'i du gzugs can snying po dang / koo sh'a mb'ir sde rgyal gyi bu shar ba dang /
analyzed: yum sgyu ma'i lha mo'i lhums su gshegs nas btsas pa'i nyin mo mnyan du yod par rgyal po au ra tshangs pas byin gyi bu gsal rgyal dang / rgyal po'i khab tu padma chen po'i du gzugs can snying po dang / koo sh'a mb'ir sde rgyal gyi bu shar ba dang /
translated: and his mother was Maya Devi. On the day of his birth, in Varanasi, King Udayana had a son, Prasenajit; in Rajagriha, King Bimbisara had a son, Ajatashatru; in Koshala, King Prasenajit had a son, Vidudabha;

original: grong khyer rab rgyal du mtha' yas mu khyud kyi bu rab snang btsas te /
analyzed: grong khyer rab rgyal du mtha' yas mu khyud kyi bu rab snang btsas te /
translated: and in the city of Pradyota, King Prasenajit had a son, Prasenajit.

original: rgyal po de rnams na re sa chen po g-yos pa ni nged kyi bu'i yon tan te /
analyzed: rgyal po de rnams na re sa chen po g-yos pa ni nged kyi bu'i yon tan te /
translated: These kings said, “The great earth shook because of the good qualities of our sons.

original: yon tan las bu'i ming rnams kyang brtags so //
analyzed: yon tan las bu'i ming rnams kyang brtags so //
translated: We will name our sons after their good qualities.”

original: mtshan mkhan gyis mtshan bltas na /
analyzed: mtshan mkhan gyis mtshan bltas na /
translated: When the astrologers examined the signs,

original: rab tu byung na ni mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung na ni mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they said, “If he becomes a monk, he will become a buddha.”

original: rab tu ma byung na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che bdun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu ma byung na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che bdun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he had not gone forth, he would have become a universal monarch with the seven treasures.

original: mtshan ni don thams cad grub par btags so //
analyzed: mtshan ni don thams cad grub par btags so //
translated: His name was given as Sarvārthasiddha.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang skrag @71b nas dpya 'bulo //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi yang skrag @71b nas dpya 'bulo //
