translated: The four great kings were frightened and offered him tribute.

original: sh'akya lnga brgya g-yog mos pa can lnga brgya lnga brgya dang rta dang ba lang cang shes lnga brgya lnga brgya'ang de dang dus gcig tu btsas so //
analyzed: sh'akya lnga brgya g-yog mos pa can lnga brgya lnga brgya dang rta dang ba lang cang shes lnga brgya lnga brgya'ang de dang dus gcig tu btsas so //
translated: Five hundred Śākyas, each with five hundred attendants, and five hundred horses and five hundred thoroughbred oxen were born at the same time.

original: don thams cad grub pas dka' ba lo drug spyad nas don med par gzigs nas yul bde 'gror grong dpon gyi bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs kyis lan bcu drug tu bzhos pa'i 'o ma sbrang rtsi can gyi thug pa gsol nas klu'i rgyal po dus can
analyzed: don thams cad grub pas dka' ba lo drug spyad nas don med par gzigs nas yul bde 'gror grong dpon gyi bu mo dga' mo dang dga' stobs kyis lan bcu drug tu bzhos pa'i 'o ma sbrang rtsi can gyi thug pa gsol nas klu'i rgyal po dus can
translated: Sarvārthasiddha practiced austerities for six years, but saw that they were pointless. He went to the village of Nāgnada and ate a porridge of honey and milk that was milked sixteen times by Nandā and Upanandā, the daughters of the village chief.

original: gyi rtsva gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i byang chub kyi shing drung du bting ste steng du bzhugs nas nam gyi gung thun la bdud btul nas mngon par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gyi rtsva gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i byang chub kyi shing drung du bting ste steng du bzhugs nas nam gyi gung thun la bdud btul nas mngon par sangs rgyas so //
translated: He sat on the grass beneath the Bodhi tree, which was the color of gold, and at midnight he conquered Mara and attained perfect Buddhahood.

original: thog mar yul 'khor mo 'jig tu nye lnga dang grong dpon gyi bu lnga bcu ste btul /
analyzed: thog mar yul 'khor mo 'jig tu nye lnga dang grong dpon gyi bu lnga bcu ste btul /
translated: First he converted the five ascetics and the fifty sons of the village chief in Varanasi.

original: ba lang gi gnas stug por drug cu sde btul /
analyzed: ba lang gi gnas stug por drug cu sde btul /
translated: In the forest of the cattle pen he converted the group of sixty.

original: bzang por mi phyed pa dang dga' mo dang dga' stobs bden pa la bkod /
analyzed: bzang por mi phyed pa dang dga' mo dang dga' stobs bden pa la bkod /
translated: In Bhadrika he established in the truth Ajnatakaundinya, Nanda, and Upananda.

original: lteng rgyas su ral pa can stong dang ga ya mgo'i mchod rten du dge slong stong po cho 'phrul gyis btul /
analyzed: lteng rgyas su ral pa can stong dang ga ya mgo'i mchod rten du dge slong stong po cho 'phrul gyis btul /
translated: In Urubilva he converted a thousand matted-hair ascetics and a thousand monks by means of miracles at the Gaya-shikharadhatu.

original: yul mnyam dga'i rgyal po gzugs can snying po lha stong phrag brgyad cu dang bram ze brgya stong bden pa la bkod /
analyzed: yul mnyam dga'i rgyal po gzugs can snying po lha stong phrag brgyad cu dang bram ze brgya stong bden pa la bkod /
translated: In the country of Samkashya he established in the truth King Bimbisara of Magadha, with his retinue of eighty thousand gods and a hundred thousand Brahmans.

original: rgyal po'i khab tu mood gal gyi bu dang sh'a ri'i bu 'khor nyis brgya lnga bcu rab tu phyung mnyan du yod par gsal rgyal btul nas mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab tu mood gal gyi bu dang sh'a ri'i bu 'khor nyis brgya lnga bcu rab tu phyung mnyan du yod par gsal rgyal btul nas mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: In Rājagṛha, Maudgalyāyana and Śāriputra were ordained with two hundred and fifty disciples. In Śrāvastī, the Buddha subdued Prasenajit and remained there.

original: yab kyis 'char ka der btang nas spyan drangs so //
analyzed: yab kyis 'char ka der btang nas spyan drangs so //
translated: The father sent Udayana there to invite the Buddha.

original: 'char ka bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'char ka bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: Udayana was told by the Blessed One:

original: sh'a ri'i bus rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rab tu byung ngo //
translated: Śāriputra will ordain you.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ser skyar gshegs nas yab dang sh'akya'i rigs rnams btul te bden pa la bkod do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ser skyar gshegs nas yab dang sh'akya'i rigs rnams btul te bden pa la bkod do //
translated: Then the Blessed One went to Kapilavastu and subdued the father and the Śākya clan, establishing them in the truth.

original: mnyan du yod par 'char ka bsod snyoms la song pa chung ma sbed mas mthong nas dud mo btab ste /
analyzed: mnyan du yod par 'char ka bsod snyoms la song pa chung ma sbed mas mthong nas dud mo btab ste /
translated: In Śrāvastī, Udayana went for alms. His wife Vedehikā saw him and cried out:🔽What are you doing, abandoning me?

original: nga bor te ci bya zhes pa dang / khyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i btsun mo grags 'dzin ma dang / mgo phyi ka la sogs pa drug stong bor nas rab tu byung na /
analyzed: nga bor te ci bya zhes pa dang / khyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i btsun mo grags 'dzin ma dang / mgo phyi ka la sogs pa drug stong bor nas rab tu byung na /
translated: If the Bodhisattva abandoned Yaśodharā, the queen, and the six thousand headed by Mahākoṣṭhila and went forth,

original: 'dam dang 'dra ba khyod cig ces zhes pa dang / 'o na bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dam dang 'dra ba khyod cig ces zhes pa dang / 'o na bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: You are like a swamp!🔽 Then she said, Well, I will go forth too.

original: de bzhin du sang rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smras so //🔽'char ka 'gyod de da ltar ltung bzed nag po can dag 'phya zhing 'dug na gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sang rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smras so // 'char ka 'gyod de da ltar ltung bzed nag po can dag 'phya zhing 'dug na gal te /
translated: And she said, I will go forth tomorrow.🔽 Udayi was remorseful. If he were to go forth now, the monks with black bowls would ridicule him, saying, The monks with black bowls made this nun go forth.

original: dge slong ma 'di rab tu phyung na drug sde pos dge slong ma 'di rab tu phyung ngo zhes je thu 'phya bar 'gyur ro snyam nas rgyal po'i khab tu bros te tshul @72a du zhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'di rab tu phyung na drug sde pos dge slong ma 'di rab tu phyung ngo zhes je thu 'phya bar 'gyur ro snyam nas rgyal po'i khab tu bros te tshul @72a du zhugs so //
translated: Thinking this, he fled to Rajagriha and entered the order there.

original: sped ma phyi de nyin par 'char ka la bsdad de med nas ngu zhing 'dug pa skye dgu'i bdag mos mthong nas rab tu phyung ngo //
analyzed: sped ma phyi de nyin par 'char ka la bsdad de med nas ngu zhing 'dug pa skye dgu'i bdag mos mthong nas rab tu phyung ngo //
translated: The next day, when Udayi was sitting there, the girl was not there. She was crying. Mahaprajapati saw her and made her go forth.

original: tshul nas byung nas phyir mnyan du yod par phyi nas kha ton zer zhing 'dug pa la sbed ma phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa dang / sbun gyi spyad pa rnams dran nas 'dod chags langs pa sbed mas shes te bros so //
analyzed: tshul nas byung nas phyir mnyan du yod par phyi nas kha ton zer zhing 'dug pa la sbed ma phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa dang / sbun gyi spyad pa rnams dran nas 'dod chags langs pa sbed mas shes te bros so //
translated: Bhadra remembered the conduct of the son of the merchant, and lust arose in her. Bhadra knew this and ran away.

original: 'char kas mgo reg ma sdod cig ces bdas pa dang brla la reg ste khu ba gtor ro //
analyzed: 'char kas mgo reg ma sdod cig ces bdas pa dang brla la reg ste khu ba gtor ro //
translated: Udayin pursued her, saying, “You shaven-headed woman, stop!” He touched her thigh and his semen was emitted.🔽Then, when his lust was appeased, Bhadra returned. She washed her lower garment and said, “Look!”

original: de nas 'dod chags zhi ba dang sbed ma slar log ste smad g-yogs bskrus te lta zhes pa dang / khu ba mthong ba dang mo 'dod chags langs te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod chags zhi ba dang sbed ma slar log ste smad g-yogs bskrus te lta zhes pa dang / khu ba mthong ba dang mo 'dod chags langs te /
translated: She saw the semen and lust arose in her.

original: khu ba bkog ste mngal sgor bcug ba dang sems can dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: khu ba bkog ste mngal sgor bcug ba dang sems can dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: She took the semen and inserted it into her vagina, and she became pregnant.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis khyod 'char ka dang nyal lo zhes pa dang / bdag 'char ka dang reg kyang ma reg go zhes rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis khyod 'char ka dang nyal lo zhes pa dang / bdag 'char ka dang reg kyang ma reg go zhes rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The nuns said, “You slept with Udayin.” “I touched Udayin, but I did not sleep with him.” She told this in detail to the Blessed One.

original: 'di pham par gyur pa ma yin gyis dben par zhog la zas kyis ma brel bar zhog shig /
analyzed: 'di pham par gyur pa ma yin gyis dben par zhog la zas kyis ma brel bar zhog shig /
translated: He is not defeated, but he should be secluded and not troubled by food.

original: bu ni 'od srungs gzhon nu zhes bya ba phyis dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu ni 'od srungs gzhon nu zhes bya ba phyis dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: The son named Kāśyapa will later become an arhat.

original: de nas ston pas dgongs pa gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos 'khrur bcug pa'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro snyam nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de nas ston pas dgongs pa gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos 'khrur bcug pa'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro snyam nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Then the Teacher, thinking that the disadvantage of having a nun who is not a relative wash the robes would occur, established a rule.

original: yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong gos rnying 'khru ba 'am 'tshed dam 'chag na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //🔽gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha'i brgyud zung bdun /
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong gos rnying 'khru ba 'am 'tshed dam 'chag na spang ba'i ltung ba'o // gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha'i brgyud zung bdun /
translated: Again, if a nun who is not a relative washes, dyes, or sews the old robes of a monk, it is a downfall that is abandoned through relinquishment.

original: ma'i brgyud zung bdun gyi bar du gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i brgyud zung bdun gyi bar du gnyen pa'o //
translated: As for not a relative, relatives are those up to seven generations of paternal relatives and up to seven generations of maternal relatives.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bal dang srin bal dang / sha na'i shun pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bal dang srin bal dang / sha na'i shun pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: As for robes, they are wool, cotton, and bark cloth, and so on.

original: rnying pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi /
analyzed: rnying pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi /
translated: As for old, it means four months have passed.

original: 'khru zhes bya ba ni tha na chu'i nang du bcug pa tsam yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khru zhes bya ba ni tha na chu'i nang du bcug pa tsam yang ngo //
translated: As for washing, it means even just putting them in water.

original: 'tshed ces bya ba ni tshon gyi nang na smyug pa tsam yang ngo //
analyzed: 'tshed ces bya ba ni tshon gyi nang na smyug pa tsam yang ngo //
translated: “To boil” means to boil in dye even the size of a bamboo cane.

original: 'chag ces bya ba ni lag mthil gyis brdabs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag ces bya ba ni lag mthil gyis brdabs pa'o //
translated: “To rub” means to rub with the palm of the hand.

original: sprad ba'i ltung ba'o zhes pa ni dngos po spangs la ltung ba bshags pa'o //
analyzed: sprad ba'i ltung ba'o zhes pa ni dngos po spangs la ltung ba bshags pa'o //
translated: This is a downfall through performance, but not a downfall through enjoyment.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na gnyen pa ma yin pa la gnyen ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / gnyen ma yin pa la the tshom za bzhin 'khru 'chag la sos pa byas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na gnyen pa ma yin pa la gnyen ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / gnyen ma yin pa la the tshom za bzhin 'khru 'chag la sos pa byas na ltung ba'o //
translated: What is the downfall? If one who is not a relative thinks someone is not a relative, or if one who is not a relative is unsure of it, and then boils or rubs, there is a downfall.

original: gnyen yin pa la ma yin par du zhes pa dang gnyen la the tshom za ste byas na gnyi ga nyes @72b byas so //
analyzed: gnyen yin pa la ma yin par du zhes pa dang gnyen la the tshom za ste byas na gnyi ga nyes @72b byas so //
translated: If one who is a relative thinks someone is not a relative, or if one who is a relative is unsure of it, and then boils or rubs, there is an offense.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba bzhi ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba bzhi ba rdzogs so /
translated: The fourth class of downfalls is finished.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag phyug cing longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag phyug cing longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug ste /
translated: At that time there was a householder who was rich and had great wealth.

original: des rigs mnyam pa las chung ba blangs so //
analyzed: des rigs mnyam pa las chung ba blangs so //
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal rank.

original: de nas dus phyi zhig na khyim bdag de longs spyod zad par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas dus phyi zhig na khyim bdag de longs spyod zad par gyur to //
translated: Later, the householder's wealth was exhausted.

original: khyim bdag des bdag ni rgas te nor bsgrub mi nus so snyam nas chung ma la bzang mo rab tu 'byung ngo zhes smras pa dang / mo na re jo bar ltar bdag kyang rab tu bya'o zhes byas pa dang / des de la de bzhin du bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: khyim bdag des bdag ni rgas te nor bsgrub mi nus so snyam nas chung ma la bzang mo rab tu 'byung ngo zhes smras pa dang / mo na re jo bar ltar bdag kyang rab tu bya'o zhes byas pa dang / des de la de bzhin du bya'o zhes te /
translated: The householder thought, I am old and cannot earn wealth, and said to his wife, Bhadra, I will go forth. She said, If you go forth, I will also go forth. He said to her, So be it.

original: gcig ni dge slong ma'i nang na rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig ni dge slong ma'i nang na rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: You will go forth among the nuns.

original: khyod ni dge slong pha'i nang na rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khyod ni dge slong pha'i nang na rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: You will go forth among the monks.

original: dus phyi zhig na dge slong de bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / des gos rnying pa mthong nas khyod la lta yod dam zhes smras pa dang / bdag la ma mchis so zhes smras pa dang / dge slong des rang gi sbyar ma byin no //
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na dge slong de bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / des gos rnying pa mthong nas khyod la lta yod dam zhes smras pa dang / bdag la ma mchis so zhes smras pa dang / dge slong des rang gi sbyar ma byin no //
translated: Later, when the monk went for alms, he saw old clothes and said, Do you have anything to look at? She said, I have nothing. The monk gave her his own clothes.

original: des ston pas kun dga' bo la khyod song la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu ljongs rgyu bar dad pa rnams chos gos dang chos shig ces bka' stsal ba dang / kun dga' bos kyang de bzhin du bsgo nas ston pa 'khor dang bcas pa ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
analyzed: des ston pas kun dga' bo la khyod song la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu ljongs rgyu bar dad pa rnams chos gos dang chos shig ces bka' stsal ba dang / kun dga' bos kyang de bzhin du bsgo nas ston pa 'khor dang bcas pa ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
translated: Ānanda did as he was asked, and the Teacher, together with his retinue, set out on his travels.

original: de'i tshe na ston pa glang po che ltar g-yas phyogs su gzigs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na ston pa glang po che ltar g-yas phyogs su gzigs nas /
translated: At that time, the Teacher looked to the right, like an elephant,

original: dge slong zhig bal gos nyi tshe dang ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro pa gzigs so //
analyzed: dge slong zhig bal gos nyi tshe dang ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro pa gzigs so //
translated: and saw a monk who was going on his travels with only a woolen cloak.

original: de nas kun dga' bo la /
analyzed: de nas kun dga' bo la /
translated: Then he said to Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong sbyar gnas pa dag gis gos kyi rnyed pa med dam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong sbyar gnas pa dag gis gos kyi rnyed pa med dam /
translated: “Ānanda, have the monks who are staying here not received any robes?”

original: btsun pa rnyed pa mchis so //
analyzed: btsun pa rnyed pa mchis so //
translated: “Yes, they have, Venerable One.”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir sbyar ma med par ljongs rgyur 'gro /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir sbyar ma med par ljongs rgyur 'gro /
translated: “Then why are they going on their travels without their robes?”

original: btsun pa dge slong 'dis sbyar ma dge slong ma la btsal te //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong 'dis sbyar ma dge slong ma la btsal te //
translated: “Venerable One, this monk has asked the nuns for his robes.”

original: kun dga' bo ci dge slong ma gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong la gos len tam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ci dge slong ma gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong la gos len tam /
translated: “Ānanda, do nuns take robes from monks who are not their relatives?”

original: btsun pa len to //
analyzed: btsun pa len to //
translated: “Yes, they do, Bhadanta.”

original: de nas ston pas dge slong ma rnams la smad nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de nas ston pas dge slong ma rnams la smad nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Then the Teacher criticized the nuns and laid down a rule of training.

original: yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong las gos blangs na brjes pa ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong las gos blangs na brjes pa ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: “If a nun takes a robe from a monk who is not her relative, except in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Not her relative” is as above.

original: gos zhes bya pa ni ldum bu sha na ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya pa ni ldum bu sha na ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: “A robe” means a robe made of linen, cotton, silk, wool, or a woolen blend.

original: len zhes bya ba ni nyams su blangs pa'o //🔽brje ba ma gtogs zhes @73a * //
analyzed: len zhes bya ba ni nyams su blangs pa'o // brje ba ma gtogs zhes @73a * //
translated: “Takes” means to use.

original: bya ba ni brje ba bkol ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni brje ba bkol ba'o //
translated: “Except in exchange” means except in exchange.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense entailing relinquishment and confession” is as above.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na gnyen ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / gnyen ma yin nam zhes the tshom za zhing blangs na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na gnyen ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / gnyen ma yin nam zhes the tshom za zhing blangs na ltung ba'o //
translated: What is the offense? If she perceives him as not her relative, and she takes a robe from him, except in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If he is not her relative, but she is unsure of it, and she takes a robe from him, except in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: gnyen yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes pa dang ; gnyen yin pa la gnyen yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za bzhin blangs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnyen yin pa la ma yin par 'du shes pa dang ; gnyen yin pa la gnyen yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za bzhin blangs na nyes byas so //
translated: If one takes it while perceiving one who is a relative as not being a relative, or while doubting whether one who is a relative is a relative, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge 'dun la dbul ba'i nang du gtogs pa dang / tshig snyan par smras te byin pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la byin pa dang / rkun pos phrogs pa dang / rin gyis 'og tu byin pa dang / brjes te byin pa dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun la dbul ba'i nang du gtogs pa dang / tshig snyan par smras te byin pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la byin pa dang / rkun pos phrogs pa dang / rin gyis 'og tu byin pa dang / brjes te byin pa dang /
translated: If one gives to the Saṅgha what is to be offered to the Saṅgha, or if one gives after speaking pleasantly, or if one gives to one who is to be fully ordained, or if one gives what was stolen, or if one gives after paying a price, or if one gives after exchanging,

original: grags pa dang / bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa la 'phags ma thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes shig ces chags pa med par phul te song na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: grags pa dang / bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa la 'phags ma thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes shig ces chags pa med par phul te song na ltung ba med do //
translated: or if one gives without attachment, saying, “Noble one, out of compassion, please give this to one who has great fame and great merit,” then there is no offense.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifth class of offenses that require confession alone is finished.

original: // / ston pa ma mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa ma mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas spom dga' mo snga dro'i dus la bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas spom dga' mo snga dro'i dus la bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
translated: Then Thullanandā went for alms in the morning.

original: khyim bdag gcig gis khyim der song ba de'i chung ma rgyan gyis ba klubs nas sgo khyad du 'dug pas /🔽sbom dga' mo mthong ba dang phyag 'tshal nas sbom dga' mos chos bshad do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gcig gis khyim der song ba de'i chung ma rgyan gyis ba klubs nas sgo khyad du 'dug pas / sbom dga' mo mthong ba dang phyag 'tshal nas sbom dga' mos chos bshad do //
translated: A certain householder went to that house. His wife was adorned with ornaments and was sitting at the door.🔽When she saw Thullanandā, she bowed down to her and Thullanandā taught the Dharma.🔽She said, Please accept this cloth.

original: de yang dag pa skyes nas ras yug cig gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de la /
analyzed: de yang dag pa skyes nas ras yug cig gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de la /
translated: Thullanandā said,

original: sang dag 'chi 'am sus shes kyis //
analyzed: sang dag 'chi 'am sus shes kyis //
translated: Who knows if I will die tomorrow?

original: de ring nyid du brtul te bya //
analyzed: de ring nyid du brtul te bya //
translated: I will do it today.

original: 'chi bdag sde chen de dang ni //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde chen de dang ni //
translated: The great army of the Lord of Death

original: bdag dang bshes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bshes pa ma yin no //
translated: is not friendly to me.

original: zhes 'byung ba khyod kyis ma thos sam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba khyod kyis ma thos sam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Have you not heard this?

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma'i bla gos blangs te byin pa'i tshig bshad byas nas song ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma'i bla gos blangs te byin pa'i tshig bshad byas nas song ngo //
translated: She took the householder's wife's upper robe and gave her a robe, explaining the words, and left.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams ci'i phyir na dge slong ma gang sbyin pa des ma mgu ste /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams ci'i phyir na dge slong ma gang sbyin pa des ma mgu ste /
translated: The brahmins and householders said, For what reason is this nun not pleased with this gift?🔽She took her robe and left.

original: de'i gos na na gyis phrogs zhes mi snyan par 'dzer te /
analyzed: de'i gos na na gyis phrogs zhes mi snyan par 'dzer te /
translated: They spoke unpleasantly about her.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //🔽yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so // yang dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
translated: Having informed the Teacher of what had happened, they established a rule of training.🔽“A nun who receives a robe from a householder or a householder’s wife who is not a relative commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”🔽A number of nuns were traveling through the countryside when they were robbed by thieves.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos blangs na spang ba'i ltung ba'o zhes bcas pa dang / dge slong ma mang zhig ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las rkun pos bcom pa dang / de dag gis bsam pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos blangs na spang ba'i ltung ba'o zhes bcas pa dang / dge slong ma mang zhig ljongs rgyu zhing dong ba las rkun pos bcom pa dang / de dag gis bsam pa /
translated: They thought,

original: ston pas gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim pa la slong du ma gnang snyam @73b ste ;
analyzed: ston pas gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim pa la slong du ma gnang snyam @73b ste ;
translated: “The Teacher has not allowed us to ask non-relative householders for robes.”

original: de dag rim gyis mnyan du yod par byin pa dang / dge slong ma dag gos bslangs nas de dag gis kyang so so nas gos kyis bshugs so //
analyzed: de dag rim gyis mnyan du yod par byin pa dang / dge slong ma dag gos bslangs nas de dag gis kyang so so nas gos kyis bshugs so //
translated: They eventually arrived in Śrāvastī, where the nuns asked them for their robes.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: Having informed the Teacher of what had happened,

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: he said,

original: dge slong ma rnams snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams snga ma ni bcas pa'o //
translated: “The previous rule was a rule that I laid down.

original: 'di ni gnang ba ste bslab pa'i tshig bca'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba ste bslab pa'i tshig bca'o //
translated: This is a rule that I rescind.

original: dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: dge slong ma gang gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
translated: “A nun who receives a robe from a householder or a householder’s wife who is not a relative commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos slong na dus la bab pa ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos slong na dus la bab pa ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: Except at the right time, if a monk asks for cloth from the wife of a householder, it is a downfall by rejection, unless it is the right time.

original: de'i dus ni 'di lta bu dge slong ma'i gos phrogs pa dang / gos brlag pa dang / gos tshig pa dang / gos rlung gis khyer ba dang / gos chus khyer ba'i 'di lta bu ni dus so //
analyzed: de'i dus ni 'di lta bu dge slong ma'i gos phrogs pa dang / gos brlag pa dang / gos tshig pa dang / gos rlung gis khyer ba dang / gos chus khyer ba'i 'di lta bu ni dus so //
translated: The right time is when a nun’s cloth has been stolen, lost, burned, blown away, or carried away by water.

original: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni skyos pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni skyos pa'o //
translated: A householder is a man.

original: chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
analyzed: chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
translated: His wife is a woman.

original: de nyid du ma yin zhes pa ni nga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid du ma yin zhes pa ni nga ma bzhin no //
translated: Not from her alone means not from her alone, like me.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bal dang sha na ka la sogs pa'o //🔽dus ma gtogs zhes pa ni dus bkol ba ste ;
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bal dang sha na ka la sogs pa'o // dus ma gtogs zhes pa ni dus bkol ba ste ;
translated: Cloth means wool, silk, and so on.🔽Except at the right time means except at the right time, which is when a nun’s cloth has been stolen, lost, burned, blown away, or carried away by water.

original: rkun pos khyer zhes pa ni rkun po 'am g-yon can gyis phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkun pos khyer zhes pa ni rkun po 'am g-yon can gyis phrogs pa'o //
translated: Stolen by thieves means stolen by thieves or swindlers.

original: brlag ces bya ba ni brlag gam brjed pa'o //
analyzed: brlag ces bya ba ni brlag gam brjed pa'o //
translated: Lost means lost or forgotten.

original: tshig pa dang rlung gi khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na'o //
analyzed: tshig pa dang rlung gi khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba zhes bya ba ni de kho na'o //
translated: Burned, blown away, or carried away by water means just that.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni rin thang dang khru dang kha dog ste /
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni rin thang dang khru dang kha dog ste /
translated: The downfall is incurred by the value, the size, or the color.

original: rin thang ni k'arsh'a pa na lnga ri ba zhig blangs te lnga ri ba thong na slong pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: rin thang ni k'arsh'a pa na lnga ri ba zhig blangs te lnga ri ba thong na slong pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one accepts a robe worth five silver coins and then asks for one worth five, one commits an offense at the time of asking.

original: thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If one obtains it, one commits a downfall of forsaking.

original: k'arsh'a pa na gzhan ni du rib slong ba de bzhin du sbyar /
analyzed: k'arsh'a pa na gzhan ni du rib slong ba de bzhin du sbyar /
translated: If one asks for a robe worth another amount of silver coins, the offense is similar to the above.

original: k'arsh'a pa na lnga ri ba zhig blangs pa las lnga ri ba zhig thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: k'arsh'a pa na lnga ri ba zhig blangs pa las lnga ri ba zhig thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one accepts a robe worth five silver coins and then obtains one worth five, one commits an offense at the time of asking.

original: lhag par thob pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lhag par thob pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one obtains more than the value of the robe one asked for.

original: kha dog sngon po zhig blangs te sngon po thob na blang pa'i nyes byas /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po zhig blangs te sngon po thob na blang pa'i nyes byas /
translated: If one accepts a blue robe and then obtains a blue one, one commits an offense at the time of accepting.

original: thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: thob na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If one obtains it, one commits a downfall of forsaking.

original: sngon po ji lta ba de bzhin kha dog gzhan dang stug po dang srab mo yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po ji lta ba de bzhin kha dog gzhan dang stug po dang srab mo yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to other colors, thick and thin robes.🔽If one asks for a blue robe and obtains a yellow one, one commits an offense at the time of asking.

original: gos sngon po zhig bslangs pa las ser po zhig thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas thob na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gos sngon po zhig bslangs pa las ser po zhig thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas thob na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one obtains it, there is no offense.

original: khru gzhan yang de bzhin no ;
analyzed: khru gzhan yang de bzhin no ;
translated: The same applies to other cubits.

original: khru lnga blangs pa las lhag par thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: khru lnga blangs pa las lhag par thob na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one receives more than five cubits, then there is an offense at the time of asking.

original: lhag par thob pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lhag par thob pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one receives more than that.

original: kha tshar dang ras ma bslangs pa las ras yug gam ras chen thob pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kha tshar dang ras ma bslangs pa las ras yug gam ras chen thob pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one receives a bolt of cloth or a large piece of cloth that is not asked for, or if it has a fringe or is unwoven.

original: spang ba drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixth class of downfalls that require confession alone is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: @74a * // de nas dge slong ma mang zhig rkun pos bcom mo //
analyzed: @74a * // de nas dge slong ma mang zhig rkun pos bcom mo //
translated: Then many nuns were robbed by thieves.

original: sbom dga' mos de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: sbom dga' mos de dag la smras pa /
translated: Thulsi said to them,

original: ston pas ni dge slong ma rkun pos bcom pa'i phyir gos slong du gnang na khyed ci'i phyir mi slong /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ston pas ni dge slong ma rkun pos bcom pa'i phyir gos slong du gnang na khyed ci'i phyir mi slong / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “The Teacher has allowed nuns to ask for robes when they have been robbed by thieves. Why don’t you ask?”

original: mi nus so //
analyzed: mi nus so //
translated: “We can’t.”🔽“Well then, I’ll ask for you.”

original: sbom dga' mos 'o na khyod kyi phyir ngas blang ngo //🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: sbom dga' mos 'o na khyod kyi phyir ngas blang ngo //🔽de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Pimpaladeva said, “Well then, I will take it for you.”🔽They said,🔽

original: de ltar na slongs shig ces byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de dag gi phyir bram ze dang khyim la chos bshad nas gos mang zhig bslangs te bzang po ni bdag gis khyer ngan pa ni dge slong ma dag la byin te /
analyzed: de ltar na slongs shig ces byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos de dag gi phyir bram ze dang khyim la chos bshad nas gos mang zhig bslangs te bzang po ni bdag gis khyer ngan pa ni dge slong ma dag la byin te /
translated: Pramudita then went to the brahmins and householders and explained the Dharma, asking for many clothes. She took the good ones for herself and gave the bad ones to the nuns.

original: de dag gos rnying pa'i 'tshems shing 'khod pa dang dge slong ma dag gis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gos rnying pa'i 'tshems shing 'khod pa dang dge slong ma dag gis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: The nuns said, We are busy sewing our old clothes.

original: khyod kyis gos mang zhig thob ce na /
analyzed: khyod kyis gos mang zhig thob ce na /
translated: The nuns said, Did you get many clothes?

original: ci'i phyir gos rnying pa 'tshems /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gos rnying pa 'tshems /
translated: Why are you sewing old clothes?

original: dge slong ma dag gi smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma dag gi smras pa /
translated: The nuns said,

original: khyed kyis ni thos par zad kyis nged kyis ni mthong mod kyis sbom dga' mos bzang po ni khyer ngan pa ni nged la byin no //
analyzed: khyed kyis ni thos par zad kyis nged kyis ni mthong mod kyis sbom dga' mos bzang po ni khyer ngan pa ni nged la byin no //
translated: You have only heard about it, but we have seen it. Pramudita took the good ones for herself and gave us the bad ones.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas /
translated: They told the Teacher what had happened,

original: sbom dga' mo rnam pa du mas smad de bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //🔽dge slong ma gos 'phrogs sam /🔽gos brlag gam /
analyzed: sbom dga' mo rnam pa du mas smad de bslab pa'i gnas bcas so // dge slong ma gos 'phrogs sam / gos brlag gam /
translated: and Pramudita was scolded in many ways and the rule was laid down.🔽 If a nun's clothes are stolen,🔽or her clothes are lost,

original: gos tshig gam /
analyzed: gos tshig gam /
translated: or her clothes are burned,

original: gos rlung gis khyer ram gos chus khyer yang rung /
analyzed: gos rlung gis khyer ram gos chus khyer yang rung /
translated: Whether her robe is stolen or carried off by water,

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam /
translated: she should ask for a robe from a householder who is not a relative,

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos slongs shig gal te bram ze'am khyim bdag de dag dad pa can te dus kyi gos mang po 'bul la /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma las gos slongs shig gal te bram ze'am khyim bdag de dag dad pa can te dus kyi gos mang po 'bul la /
translated: or from the wife of a householder. If those brahmins or householders are faithful and offer many robes at the right time,

original: 'dod na dge slong ma des de las song g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las gos khag par ma len cig de las lhag par blangs na spang ba'i ltung pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod na dge slong ma des de las song g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las gos khag par ma len cig de las lhag par blangs na spang ba'i ltung pa'o //
translated: if she wishes, that nun should not take more than a top robe and a sarong from them. If she takes more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong ma gos rkun mos khyed ram chus khyer ram zhes pa nas khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma gos rkun mos khyed ram chus khyer ram zhes pa nas khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If a nun’s robe is stolen or carried off by water, and she asks for a robe from a householder who is not a relative, or from the wife of a householder who is not a relative,

original: stod g-yogs las lhag par len ces pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: stod g-yogs las lhag par len ces pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: up to “a top robe,” there are two kinds:

original: dge slong ma dang khyim pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang khyim pa'o //
translated: a nun’s and a layperson’s.

original: khyim pa'i stong g-yogs ni ras khru bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stong g-yogs ni ras khru bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: A layperson’s top robe is twelve cubits.

original: smad g-yogs kyi ras ni srid du khru bdun zhes du khru gnyis so //
analyzed: smad g-yogs kyi ras ni srid du khru bdun zhes du khru gnyis so //
translated: A sarong is seven cubits long and two cubits wide.

original: dge slong ma stong g-yogs ni ras ma bsgos pa zhig na ni sbyar ma nyis rim dang / smad g-yogs srid du khru lnga zheng du khru do'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma stong g-yogs ni ras ma bsgos pa zhig na ni sbyar ma nyis rim dang / smad g-yogs srid du khru lnga zheng du khru do'o //
translated: A nun’s upper robe is made of unsewn patches, and her lower robe is five cubits long and two and a half cubits wide.

original: de las lhag par bslangs zhes pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par bslangs zhes pa ni de las 'das pa'o //
translated: “To ask for more than that” means to ask for more than that.

original: spang pa'i ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang pa'i ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The downfall is accrued when the robe is received.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na khyim pa'i stod @74b g-yogs dang smad g-yogs blangs te /
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na khyim pa'i stod @74b g-yogs dang smad g-yogs blangs te /
translated: What kind of downfall is it? If a nun asks for a householder’s upper robe or lower robe,

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs thob pa las lhag par blangs na bslang ba'i tshe nyes byas thob pa na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs thob pa las lhag par blangs na bslang ba'i tshe nyes byas thob pa na ltung ba'o //
translated: and receives one that is larger than the prescribed size, she commits an offense at the time of asking for a robe that is larger than the prescribed size.

original: dge slong ma stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to a nun’s upper robe and lower robe.

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs bslang ba se thob na mi langs na ma slongs shig /
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs bslang ba se thob na mi langs na ma slongs shig /
translated: If a nun asks for a householder’s upper robe or lower robe, and receives one that is larger than the prescribed size, she should not keep it.

original: lhag ma'ang ma byin cig /
analyzed: lhag ma'ang ma byin cig /
translated: She should not accept any extra.

original: dge slong ma'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs blangs te /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs blangs te /
translated: If a nun asks for a nun’s upper robe or lower robe,

original: thob na ma langs na slongs shig /
analyzed: thob na ma langs na slongs shig /
translated: and receives one that is larger than the prescribed size, she should return it.

original: lhag na phyir byin cig /
analyzed: lhag na phyir byin cig /
translated: If you have any left over, return it.

original: gos spangs par gyur pa de ma spangs sam /
analyzed: gos spangs par gyur pa de ma spangs sam /
translated: “Have you abandoned the robe that you have relinquished?

original: ltung ba ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: ltung ba ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na /
translated: “If you obtain another without having confessed the downfall,

original: de snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be relinquished by the force of the previous relinquishment.

original: spang ba bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventh part on relinquishment is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na zhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na zhugs so //
translated: The Teacher entered Śrāvastī.🔽There a householder slept with another’s wife, and his wife slept with other men.

original: de na khyim bdag cig gzhan gyi chung ma dang nyal ba dang / chung mas ma nyal cig ces bsgo nas btung nas chung ma yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang nyal bar gyur te /🔽khyim so kun ni zhig nas bran mo mngags gzhug pa cig yod pa la /
analyzed: de na khyim bdag cig gzhan gyi chung ma dang nyal ba dang / chung mas ma nyal cig ces bsgo nas btung nas chung ma yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang nyal bar gyur te / khyim so kun ni zhig nas bran mo mngags gzhug pa cig yod pa la /
translated: The householder’s house was destroyed, and he had a female slave.

original: khyim so zhig go zhes zer nas gnyi gas rtag tu brdeg ste sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim so zhig go zhes zer nas gnyi gas rtag tu brdeg ste sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The house is destroyed!” they said, and both of them constantly beat her.

original: dus phyi zhig na sbom dga' khyim bdag bza' shug de gnyis la chos bshad na sa log par spyod pa btang ste skyabs su song /
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na sbom dga' khyim bdag bza' shug de gnyis la chos bshad na sa log par spyod pa btang ste skyabs su song /
translated: Later, Thullanandā taught the Dharma to the couple, and they gave up sexual misconduct and went for refuge.

original: bslab tshig la bkod de langs te song ngo //
analyzed: bslab tshig la bkod de langs te song ngo //
translated: She established them in the precepts and left.

original: bran mos bsams pa cung zad bdag la legs pa'i dpal yon du gyur pa'ang sbom dga' mo dri ni yin na de la phan zhig phya'o snyam pa dang / de nas dus phyi zhig na chung ma na re jo bo sbom dga' mos ni bdag cag gnyis kyi ge ba'i bshes gnyen bgyis te dri ma dang phral nas bslab tshig la bkod na de la phan pa cung zad cig dbul bar bya'o zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: bran mos bsams pa cung zad bdag la legs pa'i dpal yon du gyur pa'ang sbom dga' mo dri ni yin na de la phan zhig phya'o snyam pa dang / de nas dus phyi zhig na chung ma na re jo bo sbom dga' mos ni bdag cag gnyis kyi ge ba'i bshes gnyen bgyis te dri ma dang phral nas bslab tshig la bkod na de la phan pa cung zad cig dbul bar bya'o zhes byas pa dang /
translated: Later, her husband said, “Noble lady, Pūrvapāla has been a good friend to us. She has removed our stains and placed us in the precepts. We should offer her something in return.”

original: khyim bdag gis ras yug cig bskon no zhes smras pa dang / brar mos thos te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis ras yug cig bskon no zhes smras pa dang / brar mos thos te /
translated: “Let us give her a bolt of cloth,” he said. The servant overheard this.

original: sbam dga' mo snga dro bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing khyim bdag der 'ongs pa dang 'phags ma dgyes pa skyed cig /
analyzed: sbam dga' mo snga dro bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing khyim bdag der 'ongs pa dang 'phags ma dgyes pa skyed cig /
translated: When Pūrvapāla came to the house for alms the next morning, the servant said, “Noble lady, please be happy.

original: khyim bdag pho mo gnyis kyis khyed la ras yug cig sbyin par byas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag pho mo gnyis kyis khyed la ras yug cig sbyin par byas so //
translated: The man and his wife have given you a bolt of cloth.”

original: de nas sbom dga' mo bram mo la yid ma ches bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas sbom dga' mo bram mo la yid ma ches bzhin du /
translated: Pūrvapāla did not believe the servant.

original: de gnyis kyi khyim du song nas bdag gis da dung ras de thob po zhes smras pa dang / khyim bdag gis bdag @75a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khyim du song nas bdag gis da dung ras de thob po zhes smras pa dang / khyim bdag gis bdag @75a * //
translated: When she went to their house and said, I have obtained the cloth, the householder said,

original: cag gis gsang ste bgros nas 'phags mas su la gsan zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos na rab tu byung nas yun ring du lon na de tsam yang mi shes sam zhes pa dang / de gnyis kyi ras yug de phul ba dang /
analyzed: cag gis gsang ste bgros nas 'phags mas su la gsan zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos na rab tu byung nas yun ring du lon na de tsam yang mi shes sam zhes pa dang / de gnyis kyi ras yug de phul ba dang /
translated: We discussed this in secret. Did the noble lady hear this? I have been a nun for a long time. Do you think I do not know this?

original: ma mgu nas khyed gnyis ras lug 'di byin pa'i bsod nams ni yod la /
analyzed: ma mgu nas khyed gnyis ras lug 'di byin pa'i bsod nams ni yod la /
translated: They gave her the cloth, but she was not satisfied and said, You two have the merit of giving this cloth,🔽but you do not have the merit of using it. Take it and give me another cloth.

original: spyad pa'i bsod nams ni med kyis 'di khyer la ras gzhan byin cig ces byas pa dang / khyim bdag gi chung mas khyol jo bo tshong dus nas ras bzang po zhig long la phul cig /
analyzed: spyad pa'i bsod nams ni med kyis 'di khyer la ras gzhan byin cig ces byas pa dang / khyim bdag gi chung mas khyol jo bo tshong dus nas ras bzang po zhig long la phul cig /
translated: The householder's wife said, Husband, get a good piece of cloth from the marketplace and give it to her.

original: khyim bdag gis kyang sbom dga' mo khrid nas tshong dus ras rin thang chen po zhig tshor ba las nyos nas sbom dga' mo la phul lo //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis kyang sbom dga' mo khrid nas tshong dus ras rin thang chen po zhig tshor ba las nyos nas sbom dga' mo la phul lo //
translated: The householder also took Pūrvakācāpā to the marketplace and bought a very expensive piece of cloth, which he gave to Pūrvakācāpā.

original: tshong pa de yang dus tshang nas khyim bdag des rin pa thang chen po ma 'khor nas tshong pas bzung ba dang / dad pa'i bram ze dang khyim pa rnams 'phya nas de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: tshong pa de yang dus tshang nas khyim bdag des rin pa thang chen po ma 'khor nas tshong pas bzung ba dang / dad pa'i bram ze dang khyim pa rnams 'phya nas de lta bur gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The merchant was always there, and the householder never paid him the full price. The merchant seized him, and the faithful brahmans and householders ridiculed him. They told the Teacher what had happened, and he laid down the rule.

original: dge slong ma'i phyir khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyen ma yin pas gos kyi rin zhig spags nas bdag gis gos kyi rin 'dis ni 'di lta bu 'di 'dra pa'i gos zhig nyos la dge slong ma ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs na /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i phyir khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyen ma yin pas gos kyi rin zhig spags nas bdag gis gos kyi rin 'dis ni 'di lta bu 'di 'dra pa'i gos zhig nyos la dge slong ma ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs na /
translated: If a householder or a householder’s wife who is not a relative sets aside the price of cloth and thinks, “With this price of cloth I will buy such-and-such cloth, and when the nun named so-and-so comes,

original: de la gos rung ba dus su skon no snyam pa las /
analyzed: de la gos rung ba dus su skon no snyam pa las /
translated: I will give it to her at the appropriate time,”

original: de la sngar ma bsgo bar gal te dge slong ma de rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung tshe /
analyzed: de la sngar ma bsgo bar gal te dge slong ma de rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung tshe /
translated: and if that nun, without first being invited,

original: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa'i gan du song la /
analyzed: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa'i gan du song la /
translated: goes to that householder or householder’s wife who is not a relative🔽and says,🔽“Excellent, householder!

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa bdag gi phyir gang gos kyi rin spags pa'i gos kyi rin des tshe dang ldan pa gos 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba zhig nyos la gos rung ba dus su bdag la bskon na legs so zhes smras te gos
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa bdag gi phyir gang gos kyi rin spags pa'i gos kyi rin des tshe dang ldan pa gos 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba zhig nyos la gos rung ba dus su bdag la bskon na legs so zhes smras te gos
translated: For the sake of a good robe, he says to a monk, “Venerable, for my sake, buy such-and-such a robe with this robe-money. It would be good if you would give it to me at the right time.”

original: mngon du grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du grub na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If he gets the robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong ma'i phyir zhes bya nas khyim bdag ces pa'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i phyir zhes bya nas khyim bdag ces pa'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: For the sake of a nun … for the sake of a trainee nun … for the sake of a novice monk … for the sake of a novice nun … for the sake of a male lay follower … for the sake of a female lay follower …

original: gos kyi rin zhes pa ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rin zhes pa ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Robes” means gold, silver, and so on.

original: gos 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba nyos zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang dbyibs brtags pa gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba nyos zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang dbyibs brtags pa gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Buy such-and-such a robe” refers to any kind of material or design.

original: dge slong ma ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs na zhes pa sbom dga' mo'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs na zhes pa sbom dga' mo'o //
translated: “The nun named so-and-so” refers to Thullanandā.

original: de la gos rung ba bskon no zhes bya ba ni spyad du bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gos rung ba bskon no zhes bya ba ni spyad du bzod pa'o //
translated: “I will give her a suitable robe” means “I will give her a robe that is allowable.”

original: sngar ma bsgo zhes bya ba ni sngar ma sbran pa'o //
analyzed: sngar ma bsgo zhes bya ba ni sngar ma sbran pa'o //
translated: “Without first being invited” means “without first being asked.”

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar slong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar slong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Some thought means some such thought arose.

original: gos kyi rin des gos 'di lta bu @75b 'di 'dra ba nyos zhes bya ba ni bdun las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rin des gos 'di lta bu @75b 'di 'dra ba nyos zhes bya ba ni bdun las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase with that price of cloth, buy such-and-such cloth means any of the seven.

original: bzong po 'dod ces bya ba ni mchog 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bzong po 'dod ces bya ba ni mchog 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase wanting the best means wanting the most expensive.

original: nyes pa ji la bu zhe na rin dang kha dog dang khru tshad de gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ji la bu zhe na rin dang kha dog dang khru tshad de gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: What is the fault? The price, the color, and the size, as above.

original: skud pa blangs pa las ras ma thob bam ras ma blangs pa las ras chen thob pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skud pa blangs pa las ras ma thob bam ras ma blangs pa las ras chen thob pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one obtains a small cloth from the thread, or a large cloth from the small cloth.

original: spang ba brgyad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba brgyad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eighth training rule is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
translated: The Teacher was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: bslab pa'i gnas bcas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gong ma bzhin te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas bcas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gong ma bzhin te /
translated: Up to “the training rule,” as above.

original: khyad par ni khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung mas so so nas gos kyi rin zhig spags te zhes smos so //
analyzed: khyad par ni khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung mas so so nas gos kyi rin zhig spags te zhes smos so //
translated: The difference is that a householder or a householder’s wife has set aside the price of cloth.

original: ltung ba lci yang khyad par gong ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ltung ba lci yang khyad par gong ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The difference in the seriousness of the offense is as above.

original: spang ba dgu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba dgu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ninth chapter on the prohibition of the nine things is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na sbom dga' mo snga dro rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms rgyu ba las blon po bram zed byar byed kyi khyim du song ngo //🔽des dbyar byed la chos bshad pa dang / de yang chos la dga' bas k'arsh'a pa na drug cu gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos sbyin pa'i tshig bcad byas te song ngo /
analyzed: de'i tshe na sbom dga' mo snga dro rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms rgyu ba las blon po bram zed byar byed kyi khyim du song ngo // des dbyar byed la chos bshad pa dang / de yang chos la dga' bas k'arsh'a pa na drug cu gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / sbom dga' mos sbyin pa'i tshig bcad byas te song ngo /
translated: At that time, Thullanandā was going for alms in Rājagṛha in the morning and went to the house of the brahman Dīrghanakha.🔽She explained the Dharma to Dīrghanakha, and he, being fond of the Dharma, said, I will offer sixty kārṣāpaṇas. Thullanandā made the statement of giving and left.

original: dbyar zla ba gsum 'das te chos gos byas te dbyar byed kyi gan du song ste phyin pa dang / dbyar byed la mkhyen par mdzod cig bdag ni mnyan du yod par ston pa la phyag 'tshal du mchi'o zhes smras pa dang // 'phags ma rgya mtsho'i pha rol du gshegs kyang pa na drug cu bskur ro zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: dbyar zla ba gsum 'das te chos gos byas te dbyar byed kyi gan du song ste phyin pa dang / dbyar byed la mkhyen par mdzod cig bdag ni mnyan du yod par ston pa la phyag 'tshal du mchi'o zhes smras pa dang // 'phags ma rgya mtsho'i pha rol du gshegs kyang pa na drug cu bskur ro zhes byas pa dang /
translated: After the three months of summer had passed, she made her Dharma robes and went to Dīrghanakha. When she arrived, she said, Dīrghanakha, please know that I am going to Śrāvastī to pay homage to the Teacher. He said, Noble lady, even if you go to the other side of the ocean, I will send sixty kārṣāpaṇas.

original: sbom dga' mos tshigs bcad byas te song ngo //
analyzed: sbom dga' mos tshigs bcad byas te song ngo //
translated: Thīșa spoke a verse and left.

original: mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / de nyid du dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang na 'dug go //
analyzed: mnyan du yod par phyin pa dang / de nyid du dge slong ma'i dbyar mo thang na 'dug go //
translated: When she arrived in Śrāvastī, she stayed in the rainy season quarters for nuns.

original: de nas dbyar byed kyi tshong pa la pa na drug cu bskur te /
analyzed: de nas dbyar byed kyi tshong pa la pa na drug cu bskur te /
translated: Then she sent a merchant named Vārṣaga to Pāṇḍya with sixty loads.

original: tshong pa mnyan du yod pa na dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du phyin nas sbom dga' mo bzhugs sam zhes dris pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis bsod snyoms la song ngo zhes byas pa dang / tshong pa slar log ste bdag gi 'di lta bu zhig tu byon cig gsungs shig /
analyzed: tshong pa mnyan du yod pa na dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du phyin nas sbom dga' mo bzhugs sam zhes dris pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis bsod snyoms la song ngo zhes byas pa dang / tshong pa slar log ste bdag gi 'di lta bu zhig tu byon cig gsungs shig /
translated: The merchant went to Śrāvastī and asked in the nuns’ rainy season quarters, “Where is Thīșa?” The nuns said, “She went for alms.” The merchant returned and said, “Please come to such and such a place.”

original: de nas song ba dang sbom dga' mos 'ongs pa la dge slong ma dag gis rgyas par smras nas /
analyzed: de nas song ba dang sbom dga' mos 'ongs pa la dge slong ma dag gis rgyas par smras nas /
translated: Then she went. Thīșa asked the nuns who came, “What is the matter?”

original: sbom dga' mos dge slong ma zhig khrig de song pa dang / tshong pas rgyang ring po nas 'ongs pa mthong nas 'di ni rings par 'ongs pa las na sbom dga' mo yin par nges so snyam mo //🔽sbom dga' mo @76a * //
analyzed: sbom dga' mos dge slong ma zhig khrig de song pa dang / tshong pas rgyang ring po nas 'ongs pa mthong nas 'di ni rings par 'ongs pa las na sbom dga' mo yin par nges so snyam mo // sbom dga' mo @76a * //
translated: ” The merchant saw her coming from a distance and thought, “She’s coming quickly. She must be Thullanandā.”🔽Thullanandā came up to the merchant and said, “Did you bring sixty kārṣāpaṇas?”

original: der 'ongs nas tshong pa la k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu khyer te 'ongs sam smras pa dang tshong pas kyang phul lo //
analyzed: der 'ongs nas tshong pa la k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu khyer te 'ongs sam smras pa dang tshong pas kyang phul lo //
translated: The merchant gave them to her.

original: de nas tshong pa'i khye'u gsar du dad pa skyes pa zhig la gtams nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshong pa'i khye'u gsar du dad pa skyes pa zhig la gtams nas song ngo //
translated: Then she entrusted the money to a young merchant who had recently become a devotee and left.

original: tshong pa'i khrims las nyi ma shar nas tshong dus su ma grams na k'ar sh'a pa na drug cus chad pas gcod do //
analyzed: tshong pa'i khrims las nyi ma shar nas tshong dus su ma grams na k'ar sh'a pa na drug cus chad pas gcod do //
translated: The rule of merchants is that if you don’t sell your goods at the market when the sun rises, you are fined sixty kārṣāpaṇas.

original: sbom dga' mos nang par k'ar sh'a pa na byin cig ces byas pa dang / khye'us 'phags ma cung zad bzhes shig sbom dga' mos de ltar mi rung gi byin cig ces gos kyi mtha' nas bzung ba dang / khye'u khros te k'ar sh'a pa na phyung ste mdun du bor ba dang /
analyzed: sbom dga' mos nang par k'ar sh'a pa na byin cig ces byas pa dang / khye'us 'phags ma cung zad bzhes shig sbom dga' mos de ltar mi rung gi byin cig ces gos kyi mtha' nas bzung ba dang / khye'u khros te k'ar sh'a pa na phyung ste mdun du bor ba dang /
translated: “Noble lady, please take a little,” said the boy. “It is not right,” said Śāri, “but give it to me.” She grabbed the edge of his garment, and the boy got angry. He pulled out the kārṣāpaṇa and threw it in front of her.

original: sbom dga' mos smras pa /
analyzed: sbom dga' mos smras pa /
translated: Śāri said,

original: grongs la byin cig khye'u bgrang ba la zhugs pa dang nyi ma shar nas k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu phab po //
analyzed: grongs la byin cig khye'u bgrang ba la zhugs pa dang nyi ma shar nas k'ar sh'a pa na drug cu phab po //

original: gser dang dngul dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang shel dang sa le sbram dang aasma garbha la reg na ltung pa'o //
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang shel dang sa le sbram dang aasma garbha la reg na ltung pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall to touch gold, silver, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystal, refined gold, or emeralds.

original: @78a * // zangs kyi dong tse mtshan mas btab pa sdom pa la reg na nyes byas /
analyzed: @78a * // zangs kyi dong tse mtshan mas btab pa sdom pa la reg na nyes byas /
translated: It is a minor infraction to touch a copper coin stamped with a religious symbol.

original: lcags dang zangs dang khar ba dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng la reg na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lcags dang zangs dang khar ba dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng la reg na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in touching iron, copper, horn, shell, or stone.

original: tha na sog ma'i phreng ba dang nor bu ma phug pa dang mthing bu la reg na nyes byas so //
analyzed: tha na sog ma'i phreng ba dang nor bu ma phug pa dang mthing bu la reg na nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor infraction to touch even a straw mat, an uncut gem, or a piece of string.

original: ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
translated: The Teacher was staying in Śrāvastī.🔽In the country of Campā, a householder named Bhadradatta had built a temple.

original: yul tsam pa na khyim bdag dad pa bzang pos byin zhes bya ba'i gtsug lag khang dge slong ma dag cig tshul du zhugs te /
analyzed: yul tsam pa na khyim bdag dad pa bzang pos byin zhes bya ba'i gtsug lag khang dge slong ma dag cig tshul du zhugs te /
translated: Some nuns were staying there.🔽When the rainy season was over, they said, “We are going to see the Teacher. Please give us some clothes.”

original: dbyar tshul nas 'byung kar bdag cag ni ston pa la phyag 'tshal du 'dong gis gos stsol cig ces pa dang / 'phags ma gos bzang po ma mchis te /
analyzed: dbyar tshul nas 'byung kar bdag cag ni ston pa la phyag 'tshal du 'dong gis gos stsol cig ces pa dang / 'phags ma gos bzang po ma mchis te /
translated: “Noble ladies, I have no fine clothes.

original: tshor pa 'ong ba la skad cig cung bzhes shig /🔽de las bzang po 'jal te gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / med na gos ngan pa'ang rung gis byin cig /
analyzed: tshor pa 'ong ba la skad cig cung bzhes shig / de las bzang po 'jal te gsol lo zhes byas pa dang / med na gos ngan pa'ang rung gis byin cig /
translated: Wait a moment until I feel it.🔽If it is not good, then give me a poor one.

original: bdag ni bzang po sbyin na ngan pa gsol du mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag ni bzang po sbyin na ngan pa gsol du mi rung ste /
translated: I can only give you a good one, not a poor one.

original: khyed ring na na bza'i rin k'ar sh'a pa na snoms te /
analyzed: khyed ring na na bza'i rin k'ar sh'a pa na snoms te /
translated: If you are going far, take the price of the garment, a kārṣāpanṇa,

original: bzhud cig ces pa dang / bdag cag k'ar sh'a pa na len du bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes dong ngo //
analyzed: bzhud cig ces pa dang / bdag cag k'ar sh'a pa na len du bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes dong ngo //
translated: and go. They said, The Blessed One has not allowed us to take kārṣāpanṇas, and left.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The nuns said,

original: khyed gos ngan na ci nyes zhes pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: khyed gos ngan na ci nyes zhes pa dang / dge slong ma dag gis rgyas par smras so //
translated: Why do you have poor garments? The nuns explained in detail.

original: de ltar gyur pa dge slong ma dag gis bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dge slong ma dag gis bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
translated: The nuns reported this matter to the Blessed One in detail.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: khyim bdag gam bram ze la gos kyi rin long shig bslangs nas sbyin bdag gam zhal ta pa la bsngos shig par rjes su gnang ba bcas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gam bram ze la gos kyi rin long shig bslangs nas sbyin bdag gam zhal ta pa la bsngos shig par rjes su gnang ba bcas so //
translated: If a householder or a brahmin says, “Buy cloth with this and give it to so-and-so,” then, after receiving it, he should give it to the one for whom it was intended.

original: zhal ta byed pa yul gzhan du song na yang de nyid la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa yul gzhan du song na yang de nyid la brten par bya'o //
translated: If the one for whom it was intended has gone to another country, he should give it to his relatives.🔽If there are no relatives, he should give it to the Sangha of monks or to a group or to an individual monk.

original: dge slong mas mi rung ba zhig rnyed na long la dge slong ma'i mdun du byin gyis rlobs shig dgongs shig bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas mi rung ba'i dngos po 'di lta bu zhig rnyed pas /
analyzed: dge slong mas mi rung ba zhig rnyed na long la dge slong ma'i mdun du byin gyis rlobs shig dgongs shig bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas mi rung ba'i dngos po 'di lta bu zhig rnyed pas /
translated: If a nun receives something unsuitable, she should say, ‘Venerable, consecrate this for me in the presence of a monk. I, so-and-so, have received this unsuitable thing.

original: rung ba'i dngos po bsgrubs so //
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po bsgrubs so //
translated: I will make it suitable.’🔽And a second time…

original: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du'o //
translated: And a third time she should say this.

original: spang ba bcu gcig pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba bcu gcig pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eleventh rule, the training rule on what is unsuitable, is finished.

original: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ston pa mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Teacher was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na bcu gnyis sde mtshan mas btab pa sna tshogs la spyod de /🔽sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcu gnyis sde mtshan mas btab pa sna tshogs la spyod de / sbyor bar byed /
translated: At that time the group of six were using various kinds of seals.🔽They were making them.

original: spel bar byed /🔽'phel bar byed /
analyzed: spel bar byed / 'phel bar byed /
translated: They were increasing them.🔽They were expanding them.

original: sgyur bar byed /
analyzed: sgyur bar byed /
translated: They were exchanging them.

original: brdungs pas brdungs pa nyo //
analyzed: brdungs pas brdungs pa nyo //
translated: They were buying what was beaten.

original: brdungs pas ma brdungs pa nyo bas khyim pa dag smod cing @78b mi snyan pa 'dzer to //
analyzed: brdungs pas ma brdungs pa nyo bas khyim pa dag smod cing @78b mi snyan pa 'dzer to //
translated: The laity criticized and disparaged them, saying, “They are not to be trusted.

original: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ston pa la gsol nas bslab pa'i gnas bcas so /
translated: ” When the Teacher was informed of this, he laid down a rule.

original: yang dge slong ma gang mtshan mas btab pa mang por sgyur bar byed na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong ma gang mtshan mas btab pa mang por sgyur bar byed na spang ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: “If a nun has many seals made, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong ma zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽rnam pa mang po zhes pa ni mtshan mas btab pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no // rnam pa mang po zhes pa ni mtshan mas btab pa'o //
translated: “A nun” means a fully ordained Buddhist monastic.🔽“Many” means many seals.

original: mang por spyod par byed ces pa ni gser dngul lo //
analyzed: mang por spyod par byed ces pa ni gser dngul lo //
translated: “To have made” means to have made seals of gold and silver.

original: spang ba'i ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na spyod pa zhes bya ba ni yul phyogs tshol zhing rta tshol yul phyogs su brin pa'i zong rnams rdzong ngo //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung ba ni snga ma bzhin no // ltung ba ji lta bu zhe na spyod pa zhes bya ba ni yul phyogs tshol zhing rta tshol yul phyogs su brin pa'i zong rnams rdzong ngo //
translated: “Relinquishment and confession” are as above.

original: gsel ba'i rnams tshol /
analyzed: gsel ba'i rnams tshol /
translated: “What kind of offense?” means “to use” means to seek out a place, to seek out a horse, to seek out goods to sell in a certain place, to seek out a merchant, to seek out a weaver, to seek out a tailor, to seek out a farmer, and to seek out a trader.

original: gro ba dang ras phyis dang smyi gu tshol zhing skyed tshol nam grub kyi bar du nyes byas /🔽grub na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gro ba dang ras phyis dang smyi gu tshol zhing skyed tshol nam grub kyi bar du nyes byas /🔽grub na ltung ba'o //
translated: If she seeks out a merchant, a weaver, a tailor, a farmer, or a trader, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If she seeks out a place, a horse, or goods to sell in a certain place, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: spel ba ni brgyad ka dang bdun ka dang bcu kar gtong zhing gong ma bzhin du ma grub kyi bar du nyes byas /
analyzed: spel ba ni brgyad ka dang bdun ka dang bcu kar gtong zhing gong ma bzhin du ma grub kyi bar du nyes byas /
translated: Increasing is to give eight, seven, or ten to one person, and it is a fault until one is able to do it as above.

original: grub na spang ba'o //
analyzed: grub na spang ba'o //
translated: If one is able to do it as above, it is a downfall.🔽When increasing, it is a fault to give to one person at once, to give to one person in installments, and to seek a vessel and letters as above.

original: 'phel bar byed pa na 'phral du ba dang / rkang so dang gyur du gtong zhing snod dang yi ge tshol ba'i bar du gong ma bzhin te nyes byas dang ltung ba yang gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa na 'phral du ba dang / rkang so dang gyur du gtong zhing snod dang yi ge tshol ba'i bar du gong ma bzhin te nyes byas dang ltung ba yang gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The faults and downfalls are also as above.
